Её цель в жизни, это вырастить и воспитать детей и внуков. Расширить хозяйство и улучшить условия жизни.
texts.en: Kuljakan is a member of the "Jakshylyk" group. She is 60 years old, married and a mother of five children which gives her the distinction of a "Mother Hero". Most of her children have now started their own families. Kuljakan is an honest and vivacious woman. Despite the fact that both her and her husband are retired, Kuljakan continues to keep herself busy and is running a diary business. Her husband helps her with the animals. Kuljakan and her husband started raising their own livestock after the fall of Soviet Union. Because of their hard work and dedication their herd grew and the business is doing well. The two also farm and the monthly family income is 3,000 com (KGS). In order to keep improving their farm Kuljakan has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) which she plans to use to purchase heifers. In the future Kuljakan wants to continue expanding her dairy business. Her goal in life now is to raise and educate all her children and grandchildren so she has to keep expanding the farm and improving their lives.

loans.use: To buy a livestock, she is planing to buy one young cow

loans.name: Servio

texts.es: Servio de  43 años de edad, de la localidad del Jicaral,  casado con dos hijos  menores de edad, en edades comprendidas de 14 y 9 años y  estudian  en primaria y secundaria. Servio tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación  desde  hace  9 años. Una pulpería es una tienda que vende productos comestible de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como bolsitas de café, bolsitas de shapoo, bolsitas de salsa de tomate, jugos en latas, gaseosas, frijoles cosidos, pan, azúcar, tiste, chicha. El negocio lo inicio como una fuente de trabajo para ayudar  con los gastos del hogar. Servio ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 y ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar sus ganancias. Servio agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el puedo tener una fuente de trabajo digna para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Servio is 43 years old and from the community of Jicaral.  He is married with two young children aged 14 and 9 who are studying in primary and secondary school.  Servio has as his primary business, a "pulperia," or grocery store, located in his home, which he has been running for the past 9 years.  A "pulperia" is a small store that sells a variety of groceries and daily necessities in small quantities such as bags of coffee, shampoo, packets of tomato sauce, cans of juice, sodas, refried beans, bread, sugar, tiste (a mixed corn and cacao beverage), and chicha (a drink made from fermented corn).  The business was started as a way to help with the household expenses.  

Servio has worked before with Fundación León 2000 and has shown himself to be responsible with his payments in both time and form.  The objective of this loan is to invest in his working capital and stock his grocery to fulfill the needs of his customers and improve his earnings.  Servio is thankful for the help that the investors of Kiva have given him, as it is thanks to their help that he is able to sustain his family through dignified means.

loans.use: to invest in his business and fill his grocery store with products like bags of coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, juices in cans, sodas, prepared beans, bread, sugar, and traditional beverages like tiste and chicha.

loans.name: Leonel De Jesus

texts.es: Leonel, 58años e edad, de oficio comerciante vende zapatos para dama y caballeros, originario de León, casado, padre de dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad ambos está estudiando. En busca de una futuro mejor. Su experiencia como comerciante la adquirió desde muy joven  cuando vendía bolsos, carteras y fajas. Luego se propuso emprender su propio negocio vendiendo sandalia, zapatos para damas ya que ellas son sus clientes más afluentes. Su idea es ir ofreciendo variedad de artículos sus clientes tratando de incorporar productos acorde con sus necesidades personales y del hogar. Por tal motivo está solicitando el crédito para comprar fajas de cuero, mochilas, valijas, zapatos, bolsos, abanicos, licuadoras. Este financiamiento la ayudara a ofrecer más variedad y ofrecer a precios más accesible que sus competidores.
texts.en: Leonel, aged 58, is a trader who sells shoes for ladies and gentlemen and is a native of León, married, and the father of two children, ages 18 and 15 who are both in school, in search of a better future.  His experience as a merchant began at an early age, when he sold handbags, wallets and belts.  He later opened his own business selling a variety of sandals for women, as they tend to be his most well-off customers.  His idea is to offer a variety of articles for his customers, trying to incorporate products according to their personal needs and the needs of their households.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy leather belts, backpacks, valises, shoes, bags, fans, and blenders. This funding will help him to offer a greater variety at more affordable prices than those of his competitors.

loans.use: to buy leather belts, backpacks, luggage, shoes, bags, fans, and blenders.

loans.name: Amina

texts.ru: Амине 60 лет,проживает с мужем. Амина родилась в простой и многодетной семье фермера, с детства была самостоятельным ребенком и помогала матери по уходу за домом. Амина получила высшее образование . С мужем они воспитали  двоих детей. который проживают в Бишкеке.По характеру Амина очень жизнерадостная, добрая и честная женщина. Они с мужем на пенсии.  Муж Амины помогает ей по хозяйству.С 1992 года Амина начала заниматься животноводством. Их начальный капитал составлял 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря их трудолюбию и целеустремленности на сегодняшний день у них в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы и 20 овец и 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход семьи составляет около 3,000 сом.В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Амина обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS)на покупку коровы и овец. За счет доходов от полученного кредита планируют увеличить поголовье скота и соответсвенно улучшить условия жизни.В будущем Амина собирается увеличеть поголовье скота. И осуществит давнюю мечту купить машину.
texts.en: Amina is 60 years old and lives with her husband. She was born to a simple farm family as one of many children but grew up as a very independent child and always helped her mother around the house. Amin has a college education and has raised two children with her husband who now live in Bishkek. Amina is a kind an honest woman and loves life. She and her husband are now retired but have started a livestock farm together in 1992. They began their business with 1,000 som (KGS) but their hard work and perseverance helped them expand the herd to include 4 cows, 20 sheep and 2 horses. The monthly profit of the family is about 3,000 som (KGS). In order to continue expanding her livestock business, Amina has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) which she will use to purchase a cow and a few sheep. Amina is planning to use the profits from this loan to continue increasing the number of animals and so be able to improve the lives of her family. In the future Amina hopes to save enough money to purchase a car.

loans.use: to buy a cow and sheep to increase the herd

loans.name: Aurita

texts.en:
This is Aurita. She previously borrowed 20,000 PHP, which she used to purchase ready-to-wear products and merchandise to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan so that she can buy more ready-to-wear products and merchandise to expand her product inventory. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She is glad, thankful and looking forward to this financial increase.

Aurita hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and bring her family closer to God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional inventory such as ready-to-wear men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Gloria is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.  

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a resident of the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has a farming business which she has been carrying out for the last three years. Elizabeth began the business from the savings she obtained from her local women's group.

Elizabeth learned about Milango through a friend and joined the organization with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is unreliable weather.

Elizabeth is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizers, plant seeds and pay for the labor. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family. She aspires to be a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, plant seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a resident of Likoni, Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has six children.

Grace owns a food cafe, a business that she has been operating for three years. She began the business from the savings she had made while at a women's group in her area. She also sells cereal.

She learned about Milango through an employee. She aims to access credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are inflation and the seasonal business climate.

Grace is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenyan Shillings to purchase foodstuffs like cereal, cooking oil etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's standard of living. She aspires to be a cereal wholesaler in future.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs like cereal, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 39, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Walter, and is the mother of seven children. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Vilma believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Vilma operates an Internet café business. There is more need, now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or any office documentation, as well as people who would just love to surf the 'net and any social network.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (Php) in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Vilma dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and a fishing business. Gloria is borrowing 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Scholar

texts.en:
Scholar is a resident of Likoni in Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has five children. Scholar owns a food stall, a business that she has been in operating for two years. She obtained money from the savings she had made while at a women's group within her area and set up the business. Scholar is also a fruit farmer.

She learned about Milango through an employee and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are inflation and the seasonal business climate.

Scholar is applying for a loan of 5,650 Kenya shillings to purchase foodstuffs like sugar, soap, tea leaves, paraffin, cereals, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of the family. She aspires to a own a large wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, e.g. sugar, soap, tea leaves, paraffin, cereals, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Mulya Sari Group

texts.en:
In order to be a source of family income, Ni Ketut is seeking another loan to help her pig business.

With full support from her husband, Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase three local piglets for pig roll. Along with the sows, the local piglets will be sold every 2 months.

The advantage of the business is that it pays school fees. She has three children, the first one already in university and the last two still in elementary school. She hopes her children can get higher education so they can have a better future.

loans.use: To purchase three local piglets

loans.name: Jahya

texts.en:
Jahya is a 44-year-entrepreneur married to Selfina, 40. From the marriage, they are blessed with three children named Yuningsih, 18, who graduated from vocational school; Fernando, 14, who is in the third grade of elementary school; and Yerikson, 10, who is in the fifth grade of elementary school.
 
Jahya has been raising catfish since 2008. Jahya initiated his business by raising 50 catfishes. At the moment, he has three fishponds and raises 1,000 catfishes. It takes three months to raise the fish before selling them to the customer. His wife and the children are also involved in looking after them.  

Currently, Jahya really wants to enlarge his business by purchasing catfish seeds and building up the pond. Unfortunately, he does not have enough capital to go through with this plan. Jahya then went to TLM and applied a loan amounting 4,500,000 IDR (Indonesia rupiah). He would like to utilize the loan for 2,000 more catfish seeds and building materials to build one more pond. His expectation is that the business could grow smoothly and bring good advantages for his family.

loans.use: to buy 2,000 more catfish seeds and building materials to build one more pond.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: La señora Genoveva sigue con la fabricacion de calzados de cholitas desde hace bastante tiempo, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior credito compro el material que necesita crecio su negocio e incremento sus ingresos y en esta oportunidad solicito el credito para la compra de una cocina que le sera de gran utilidad para su hogar, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oprtunidad brindada.
texts.en: Genoveva has continued to create footwear for indigenous women for quite some time, noting that she did very well with the previous loan and bought necessary materials to grow her business and increase her income, and this time she has requested a loan to purchase a stove that will be very useful for her home, she feels happy and grateful for the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario Antonio es un agricultor que vive con su compañera de vida y sus nietos es una persona muy trabajadora, muy responsable, con mucha capacidad de producción ya que posee dos y media manzanas para cultivo que se encuentran en muy buenas condiciones para el desarrollo de su cosecha y se encuentran muy cerca de su lugar de residencia posee manzana y media de cultivo de yuca, tiene buen historial de pagos actualmente cuenta con un crédito de cultivo de yuca y solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y otros materiales varios para trabajar mejor su cosecha de maíz, Mario asegura poder cubrir los pagos del crédito solicitado dentro de el plazo de tiempo otorgado para cancelarlo, solicita este crédito para aprovechar al máximo sus dos y media manzanas de terreno de cultivo y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia e ir mejorando su siembras.Mario Antonio tiene fe que podra ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena
texts.en: Mario Antonio is a farmer who lives with his life companion and their grandchildren.  He is a hardworking person who is very responsible.  He has the capability to produce a lot, because he has more than 4 acres of land to cultivate that is in good condition to develop his crops.  His land is located close to his place of residence.  He has about 2 and a half acres land planted with cassava, and he has a good credit history.  He now has a loan for his cassava, and he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy fertilizers and other supplies so that he can better farm his corn crops.  Mario is certain that he can cover the payments on this loan according to the established repayment schedule.  He is requesting this loan to take maximum advantage of his 4 acres of land, so that he can improve his family's quality of life and continue to improve his crops.  Mario Antonio has faith that he will be able to offer his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn and cassava seeds, fertilizers, and other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is a hard working entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 14000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her business. Amalia has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables and root crops and has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts. With the help of the loans from NWTF she hopes to save money and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and bags, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Hailyn

texts.en:
Hailyn is 27 years old, married, and has four children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.  She also earns additional income from selling fish.

Hailyn is requesting a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.  She is working tirelessly toward saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en: Bernadith's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell and from transportation services. She is 22 years old, single and is from Taguitic, Kapatagan. She has been farming for three years and earns 5,000 PHP per month. Bernadith joined GDMPC recently and is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Trancito Del Carmen

texts.es: Trancito del Carmen de 5o anos de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos mayores de edad, e independiente. Ella es originaria del departamento de león lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Transito se desempeña como Maestra de una de la escuela de la localidad. La Sra. Transito siempre se ha caracterizado por ser responsable y buena paga, en los créditos anterior lo ha utilizado para realizara la mejoras de su casa. En la  actualidad el financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto del hijo ya que se encuentra en condiciones muy deterioradas. Con el financiamiento comprara materia de construcción como arena, cemento, bloque cal, zinc, piso, clavos, perlines. Transito agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un lugar digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Trancito del Carmen is 50 years old, is a single mother and has two children who are adults and independent. She is originally from the department of León, located in the west of the country. Trancito works as a teacher in a local school. Trancito has always been known for being responsible and a good payer. 

She used the previous loans to make improvements in her home. Now, she needs financing to invest in the construction of a room for his son, because it is in deteriorated conditions. With the financing she will buy construction materials such as sand, cement, lime blocks, zinc, floor, nails, and purlins. 

Trancito is grateful for the help provided by Kiva lenders to people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have a decent place to live.

loans.use: to make improvements in her home and buy construction material such as sand, cement, lime blocks, zinc, floor, nails and purlins.

loans.name: Martin Yeral

texts.es:
Martin  33 años de edad, es de la comarca Cucirisne, en las afuera de Teustepe él se dedica a sembrar maíz y trigo, padre de 2 hijos de 6 y 11 años de edad. También tiene sus vaquitas la cuales le permite vender leche. Cuando las siembras son bajas el sale fuera del país a trabajar cortando café. Todo lo que siembra lo vende  en la misma comarca.  Hoy solicita este crédito para comprar alambre, grapas y pagar mano de obra para que le ayuden a reparar las cercas de su potrero.
Martin dice que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que en este momento no tiene el dinero que necesita para realizar los trabajos de limpieza y mantenimiento de sus animales. 
Dice que después que cancele este crédito sacara otro crédito para la siembra del maíz, frijol y trigo el ciclo de siembra del próximo año.
texts.en:
Martin, 33 years old, is from the region of Cucirisne, on the outskirts of Teustepe. He is a father of two children aged 6 and 11 years old, and he is dedicated to planting corn and wheat,. He also has cows which allows him to sell milk. When the crops are low, he leaves the country to work picking coffee. Everything that he grows he sells in the same region. Today, he is requesting this loan to buy wire, staples and pay labor to help him repair his pasture fences.
Martin says that the loan will be helpful because at this time he does not have the money needed for the maintenance and cleaning of his animals.
He says that after he pays off this loan, he will take out another loan to plant corn, beans and wheat during next years planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy wire, staples and pay for labor.

loans.name: Diamantes - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento DIAMANTES – 26  está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,   la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Solangel tiene 25 años, tiene un hijo  de la edad de  3 años, ella se dedica al servicio de peinados y de manicurista y también maquillaje en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la zona de Santa Rosa de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Solangel va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de productos de peluquería y belleza  y también para  algunos materiales que necesita y así de esta manera incrementar  su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que necesita ampliar su negocio, la Sra. Solangel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mayor cobertura del mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado en la otorgacion del credito ya que esta es la unica actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Diamantes--26 Communal Bank is made up of eight members, six women and two men.  Solangel, 25, is the president of the bank.  She has one child, age 3, and makes a living as a hairstylist, manicurist, and make-up artist in her beauty salon in the Santa Rosa neighborhood of La Paz.

This loan is Solangel's second sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy hairdressing and beauty products, and also for some materials she needs.  This way she'll increase her working capital.  She's requesting this loan because she needs to expand her business.

The challenge Solangel faces in her business is having a greater share of the market.  She's going to use the profits to continue buying materials and improving her work.

She's happy about the loan and grateful to the institution for their help granting it to her because this is the only job that allows her to support herself.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing and beauty supplies

loans.name: El Trébol Group

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 59 años de edad y es parte del grupo "El Trébol", dice que le pusieron ese nombre por que esa plantita es de muy buena suerte y aunque anteriormente algunas personas han quedado mal con sus pagos y han salido del grupo, los integrantes que quedan por ser responsables siguen adelante con el grupo ya que entre todos se ayudan para que su grupo no quede mal con los pagos. Platica "Don Toño, el fotógrafo", como es conocido en su población, que el emprendió su negocio desde hace mas de 30 años ya que desde muy joven le llamo mucho la atención la fotografía porque sus padres le regalaron una cámara un día de su cumpleaños y que desde ahí le gusto captar imágenes de las cosas hermosas que tiene la naturaleza, así que a muy temprana hora se iba al Santuario de la Mariposa Monarca, que no está lejos de su casa, para sacar fotografías del amanecer con las mariposas cuando el sol daba sus primeros destellos de luz e iluminaba los hermosos bosques del estado de Michoacán. Dice que le llamaba tanto la atención que decidió tomar un curso de fotografía a través de correspondencia y ya que no tenía un trabajo fijo, decidió poner su estudio fotográfico y tomar los mejores momentos de las personas y así obtener ganancias de lo que le apasiona que es la fotografía. El está pidiendo a VisionFund que le brinden un crédito ya que quiere comprar el material que  ocupa para hacer su fotografía como, material para revelados, rollos para cámaras, marcos para fotografías y álbums para su venta, bolsas, cámaras digitales, USBs, etc. comenta que su material lo compra en la cuidad de México en diferentes tiendas especializadas en fotografía; él espera que le con el crédito pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Dice que su meta es hacer un local donde pueda tener su propio negocio ya que las rentas son muy elevadas y ahí tiene perdidas, también espera tener más trabajo para así hacer sus sueños realidad.
Los otros once integrantes del grupo se llaman Gabriela, Edit Veronica, Esperanza, Maria de Jesus, Ma Consuelo, Maria Eugenia, Edith, Maria Claudia, Natividad, Margarita y Juliette ellas invertirán sus créditos en artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, para la compra de insumos para realizar comida para vender, compra de insumos para elaborar pan, para la compra de pollo muerto y venderlo por kilo, para la compra de bisutería para vender, compra de zapato y ropa por catalogo, para invertir en materia prima para elaborar nieves, paletas de hielo y para la compra de frutas y legumbres de temporada para su venta.
**Deberíamos contratar a Toño para que tome nuestras fotografías =) ustedes que piensan inversionistas???
texts.en:
Antonio is 59 years old and is part of the group "El Trébol". He says they chose this name because this little plant is very lucky. Although in the past some people didn't meet their payments and left the group, the remaining members are responsible and continue with the group because they help each other so the group can meet all payments. 

"Toño, the photographer" says he is known in his town. He started his business more than 30 years ago because since young he was struck on photography because his parents gave him a camera for his birthday. From there, he likes to take pictures of all beautiful things that nature has. 

That's why he used to go to the Mariposa Monarca Sanctuary at an early hour, which is not far from his home, to take pictures of the sunrise with the butterflies when the sun had its first flashes of light and illuminated the beautiful forests of the state of Michoacán. He says that caught his attention and decided to take a photography course through correspondence. Since he didn't have a steady job, he decided to start a photo studio and take the best moments of people and thus obtain profits from what passionate him that is photography. 

He is requesting a loan to VisionFund because he wants to buy materials he uses for his photography such as material for developing, films for cameras, photo frames, albums for sale, bags, digital cameras, USB drivers, etc. He says he buys the material in the city of Mexico in several stores specialized in photography. He expects to improve the quality of life of his family with this loan.

He says his goal is to have a place where he can have his own business because rents are very high and he has losses. He also expects to have more work in order to make his dreams come true.       

The other 11 members of the group are Gabriella, Edit Veronica, Esperanza, Maria de Jesus, Ma Consuelo, Maria Eugenia, Edith, Maria Claudia, Natividad, Margarita y Juliette. They will invest their loans in items to stock grocery stores, to buy ingredients for food to sell, to buy ingredients for bread, to buy dead chickens to sell them per kilo, to buy jewelry to sell, to buy shoes and clothes by catalog, to invest in raw materials to make snow, ice-cream and to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables for sale.

We should hire Toño to take our pictures :-) What do you think, investors?

loans.use: to buy equipment for a photography studio and accessories to sell such as camera films, memories, digital cameras etc.

loans.name: Nelson Alberto

texts.es:
Nelson es de la comarca llamada Aguas fría, es casado y tiene una hija de 8 años de edad que estudia el 2do grado de primaria en la escuela de la comarca.
 Se dedica a cultivar maíz frijol trigo también compra y vende ganado desde hace 4 años Nelson dice que las vacas que posee fueron parte gracias al hermano y a su padre que le regalaron hace varios años las cuales  han ido aumentándose también parte de esos animales  que tiene los ha comprado con ingresos de la cosecha del maíz, trigo  para hacer sus trabajos agrícolas de la siembra y recolección del maíz, frijol y trigo paga mozos que le ayuden  vender su cosecha en la misma comarca.   Hoy Nelson solicita este crédito para comprar dos terneros dice que este crédito será de ayuda ya que así podrá reforzar más el negocio de compra y venta de terneros  ya que quiere aprovechar esta temporada que es la que se vende más el ternero y así poder ganar un poco más de dinero. Él dice que después que cancele este crédito sacara otro crédito siempre para invertirlo en compra y venta de terneros.
texts.en:
Nelson is from the region known as Agua Fría; he's married and has an eight-year-old daughter. She is in the second grade at the area elementary school. 

He grows corn, beans and wheat. For four years he has also bought and sold livestock. Nelson says that some of the cows he has are thanks to his brother and father, who gave them to him a few years ago, and they have been growing. Also some of these animals that he has he bought with income from his corn and wheat harvests. 

To do his agricultural work raising and harvesting corn, beans, and wheat, he pays young people to help him sell his crop in the same region. 

Today Nelson is asking for this loan to buy two calves. He says that this credit will be helpful, as he will be able to strengthen his business of buying and selling calves. He wants to take advantage of this season, as this is when he sells the most calves, so he can earn a little more money. He says that after paying back this loan, he will take out another to keep investing in the buying and selling of calves.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, plant seeds, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Adem

texts.en:
Adem is 24 years old and lives in the Ashkali community. He is married, and his wife is a housewife, staying at home to care for their one-year-old child. Adem works as a cleaner in a municipality building, and his salary is too low to meet his family's needs. 

Adem is in need of a loan to renovate his bathroom and replace the old windows in his house. This loan will help to improve the living conditions of his family. Adem hopes in the future to find a better-paying job.

Adem is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to renovate his bathroom and replace the windows in his house.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion, 65, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She lives with her children, and she helps in managing the household while operating an arcade and billiards hall where customers pay per hour of play. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, not all families can afford to buy personal computers, portable play stations, or equipment for video games. Alma has several arcade units and one billiards table, and she earns 400 PHP per day. 

To help her continue running her business, Alma is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and maintain her arcade. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. 

Salvacion hopes to be able to grow her business and dreams of having a happy family. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories about her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her arcade.

loans.name: Xiomara De Socorro

texts.es: Xiomara 29 años de edad, es de la comarca Las Canoas en las afueras de Teustepe, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa usada,  casada, madre de tres hijos, solo finalizo la primaria pues se dedicó a trabajar para ayudar a llevar alimento a su casa. Siempre con la idea de diversificar su negocio y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos desea utilizar este crédito para comprar plátanos, aceite y queso para vender comida y de igual manera también invertir en compra de ropa y cosméticos para vender en otras comunidades de manera ambulante. Pues desea poco a poco tener su tienda de mercadería variada y vender comida.
texts.en:
Xiomara, age 29, is from the region of Las Canoas in the outskirts of Teustepe. She sells cosmetics and used clothing. Married and the mother of three children, she only finished elementary school; she works to help feed her household. 

Always with the idea of diversifying her business and giving a better future to her children, she wants to use this loan to buy plantains, oil and cheese to sell food. And at the same time she also wants to invest in the purchase of clothing and cosmetics to sell in other communities as a traveling salesperson. Then she hopes, little by little, to have her variety business and to sell food.

loans.use: to buy plantains, oil and cheese, and also to invest in the purchase of clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is married with two children. Marlita is 54 years old and resides at Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Marlita owns and operates a general store for a living and she's been in this business for three years. Each month she earns 3,500 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, and soaps etc. Marlita been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Marlita wants to build house and to see her children finish school.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

Lilia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from food vending and from farming coconut and selling dried coconut meat. Lilia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is an active woman who is tenacious and dedicated to her work; she’s always seeking to make her dreams reality. She strives daily to find new opportunities for success and does not plan to give up until she reaches it.

Like any good merchant she wants to expand her sales but needs to make a new investment to do so and does not have capital to back her up. This is why she’s asking Yehu for a loan to buy more fish to sell. She is grateful for the support she receives and she tells us that since the previous loan, her living standards have improved. Everlyn has good payment references and is very responsible; she’s sure that she will repay the loan while at the same time is confident that she’ll provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a fishmonger living in Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and has three children. Fish is among the staple foods of the residents living around Bendera. She has been operating the business herself for eight years. Bendera started from her spouse’s contribution, with a limited stock of fish and has seen her capital grow with time. The business has been running in total for ten years and is a source of livelihood for their family of five.

Bendera joined Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of fish. Her ambition is to be the largest supplier of fish to the areas around Mariakani town.

The extra income will also form part of Bendera’s future savings. The challenge currently is high cost of transport since Bendera has to go and look for fish stock. She desires to set up a retail shop in the future and also to build a rental house.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fish.

loans.name: Rasel

texts.en: Rasel is 31 years old, single, and the mother of a child. She lives in Cabgan, Tambulig, where she has earned a living for the past 10 years by selling home and used products. She makes PHP 20,000 a month, and she is applying for a loan of PHP 45,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She joined GDMPC in 2008 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en: Melodina of Mahayahay, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur has been raising pigs for more than 12 years and earns 8,000 per month. She’s 58 years old now, yet continues to hang on to her piggery livelihood to give an adequate living for her four children. She been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In order to enhance her livestock upon selling, she borrows amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies. Melodina hopes that, someday, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a resident of Mariakani of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children.  

Rose owns a cereals shop, a business that she has been operating for five years. Besides this, Rose also runs a retail shop dealing in assorted goods like plates, combs, spoons, small bags, and basins. She started the business from a smaller one dealing in vegetables.

She learned about Milango through an employee and joined with an aim of obtaining credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is high fuel and transport costs. 

Rose is applying for a loan of KES 41,850 to buy a piece of land and construct a business premises. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to finish the construction of the business premises and thereby save on rent, too. She believes this will help her achieve her ambition of owning a residential house in the future.

loans.use: To to buy a piece of land and construct business premises.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 62 years old and married, with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Loreta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Loreta has been raising pigs for 10 years.  She also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed  for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a dedicated woman who has been operating a restaurant and a fresh water business for several years. Thanks for contributing to the good results she's achieved. Her aim is to remain in business so that she can achieve all her goals. 

The previous loan enabled her to increase sells in her restaurant business. The challenge she faces is with her water selling business due to frequent leakages on the water pipes. She has decided to buy new pipes so as to change the old and leaking ones. To do this, she is requesting a new loan in order to buy the new water pipes to repair the water system.

loans.use: to buy new water pipes to repair her water system.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 45-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She is a mother of a two-year-old daughter. She has been in the food vending business for ten years. She sells fish balls, saging nilusak (a pounded boiled banana mixed with sugar and grated young coconut), hot cakes (a mixture of four, sugar, butter and cooking oil), banana chips, and drinks like cold Nestea flavored tea. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like flour, sugar, cooking oil, ripe banana, fish balls, grated coconut, and Nestea flavored beverage. In the future, Anecita would like to expand her business to invest in other ventures to provide a quality education for her child.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, ripe banana, and fish ball

loans.name: Nzuki

texts.en:
Nzuki is a resident of the Mariakani area of the coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of three children. He owns a water-selling point, a business that he has been operating for three years.

He learnt about Milango through a friend and joined the company with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. His main challenges occur when some customers do not pay on time. He has also faced the challenge of unreliable supplies of water and intends to improve on his storage.

Nzuki is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenyan shillings to buy water tanks. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children. He aspires to build a dam in the future.

loans.use: to buy water tanks

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 34 years old and married, the mother of five young children.  She is from Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. 

Beatriz has been engaged in basket weaving business for more than 13 years now. Basket weaving is a common source of income in the community.

Beatriz hopes of expanding her business, but lacks the financial to do so. But with a loan from CEVI, Beatriz will finally be able to buy materials fo basket weaving, such as "buri" or native palm, bamboo sticks, straw, and other materials.

In the future, Beatriz wants to make her business successful and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving, such as buri bamboo sticks, straw, and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles for making school and office unifroms

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old, married, and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has three children. She owns and operates a sari-sari store for a living. She generates a monthly income of PHP 2,000 from this activity and has been in this business for six years. 

Josephine has applied for a loan of PHP 3,000 at GDMPC to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She's been a member of GDMPC since 2008. She hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Enhbayar is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a little house in Orhon province of Mongolia. Her son is a college student and her daughter is a secondary school student. Her husband helps her business. She has been running a public transportation business since 2009. Also, she and her husband have been managing a pig farm for four years. She and her husband are starting a construction block-producing business. She is planning to purchase a large amount of inventory for block production when prices for inventory is at the lowest of the year. She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase raw materials for block manufacturing. She is a hard-working, welcoming, and friendly person.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for block manufacturing

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of four young children from Corella, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for several years now. Moreover, she is also doing handicrafts, like basket weaving, as a living.

Elena works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of their family. As of this time, she is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs and additional items for basket weaving, such as bamboo sticks, straw, and others.

In the future, Elena dreams of making her businesses successful and continually supporting the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and additional items for basket weaving

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a making-and-selling dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her business. Milagros has been in this business for nine years. Milagros earns additional income by farming rice and coconut, and selling dried coconut meat.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is from Prenza, Tangub City. She's 39 years old, married and has 4 children. For the past 11 years she has been raising bananas to make a living, and earns 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Maribel joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy works hard to support her family. She is single and has a business making and selling native mats in the Philippines.

Jimmy has requested a PHP 12500 loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her native mat-making.

She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Jimmy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her native mat-making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 42 years old, married, and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City. Evangeline owns and operates a business buying and selling soft drinks to earn a living. She's been in this business for seven years. Each month, she earns about PHP 4,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy other types of soft drinks. In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy other types of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria Marina

texts.es: Doña María tiene 62 años de edad, es casada, vive con un hijo y su esposo en el municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa. Doña María lleva 8 años de dedicarse  a la elaboración de pan casero elabora semitas, quesadilla, pastelitos de piña, pizza, pudin, también vende topogigios (helados) de leche con coco y comida. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en su comunidad. Ella es muy conocida ya tiene buena clientela. Ella ha mantenido el negocio mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. Actualmente el que solicita es el sexto ciclo y es por 22,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar materia prima como harina, azúcar, huevos, leche, manteca, soda, bolsas y otros materiales que utiliza para la elaboración de pan, compra cantidades grandes para mantener en inventario. Su meta es surtir el negocio y mejorar la producción para darle el estudio a su hijo y en lo personal sentirse útil aportando ingresos al hogar.
texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old and married. She lives with her son and her husband in the municipality of San Francisco de Yojoa. Maria has been making homemade bread for eight years. She makes sweet breads, quesadillas, pineapple turnovers, pizza, bread pudding, as well as "topogigios" (homemade ice cream) made with milk and coconut, as well as food.

She sells as a street vendor in her community. She is very well-known and already has a good clientele. She has kept her business going by investing several loans. Currently she is applying for her sixth loan, and it is for 22,000 lempiras. She is going to use it to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, eggs, milk, lard, soda, bags and other materials that she uses to make bread. 

She buys large quantities to maintain in inventory. Her goal is to supply her business and improve her output, so that she can provide her son with an education and on a personal level, feel useful by contributing income to the household.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, eggs, lard, sugar, milk, and others for making bread.

loans.name: Elwin

texts.en: Elwin, 31, is a single entrepreneur from Aurora, Zamboaga del Sur. He makes a living by operating a transportation business, which he started 2 years ago. He now earns 6,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, Elwin is borrowing 20,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to obtain accessories and tires. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and hopes to expand his business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en: Nelinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns some additional income from farming rice, bananas and coconuts. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.  Nelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of three school-aged children. She is from Cortes, Bohol. She has been engaged in basket weaving for several years now.

Vilma wants to expand her business, but lacks the capital to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy more materials for basket weaving, such as bamboo sticks, straw, and "buri" (native palm). 

In the future, Vilma wants to explore another venture to augment her income so that she can continually send her children to school for better learning.

loans.use: to buy more materials for basket weaving, such as bamboo sticks, straw, and buri

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 54 years old. He is from the village of Apnia, Akhalkalaki District. Levan is married and lives with his family: his wife, Tamara, and 27-year-old son. Levan leads the agricultural business of the family. In particular, they have 8 milk cows, 33 calves, 200 sheep, 170 lambs, and goats. The family produces cheese and sells it locally. Besides that, Levan cultivates the family-owned agricultural land, where he grows potatoes, barley, and wheat. He does all relevant seasonal work and sells the harvested products. Levan is a very hardworking person with rich experience in his work.

He requested a loan for harvesting potatoes so he can pay the workforce. Harvested potatoes will be sold during the winter months and this will significantly increase his family's income. With the increased income, Levan will sow more potatoes, wheat, and barley, and expand the family's agricultural business. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to cover the costs of potato harvesting

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
This is Epifania, 62, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is single and manages her own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to support her everyday needs.

Epifania operates an internet café. There is more need, more now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing resumes or office documentation. There are also people who would just love to surf the 'net and any social networks. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Epifania dreams of having good health so she can continue managing her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her internet cafe

loans.name: Karachi

texts.en: Karachi is a woman with the urge to move ahead. She is liked by many people because of her kindness, honesty, and above all, the unhidden smile she always has. She always struggles to see that her family has all that they want. Karachi is taking out a new loan so as to expand her current business. She says that thanks to the loans, she has been able to increase her sales and income. She is currently requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, flour, meat, and food flavourings. These are the ingredients she basically needs to prepare foods.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, meat, and food flavourings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Jorinda

texts.en: Jorinda is from Panta-on, Ozamis City. She is 40 years old. Jorinda is married and she has nine children. To make a living, Jorinda has cultivated bananas and coconuts for 16 years and she earns 7,000 PHP per month for these activities. In 2008, Jorinda joined GDMPC. Jorinda is requesting a loan of 8,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated  as a result of this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is very enterprising and has had her store for several years. Here she has been able to provide a dignified life for her family using the income she has earned out of this business. She wants to expand her existing business. 

The new loan of 15,000 KES she is requesting is going to be used to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables and cooking oil.

With this investment, she is sure that she is going to increase her sales because she is going to have a greater supply of food.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables, and cooking oil for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop

loans.name: Revolution De Ferrier Group

texts.fr:
Yvrose est la coordinatrice de son groupe Revolution de ferrier. Elle est mariee elle est possede d'enfants. Yvrose voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir aven duit du Charbon. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son bussness.

Des autres membres Revolution de ferrier ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon et ken kay. Yvrose dit que ses défis principal est de venie une grande commercant. Yvrose habite dans la région de ferrier d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité Amboise a dirigé son commerce de Charbon pendant les 15 dernières années.
texts.en: Yvrose is the coordinator of her group, Revolution de Ferrier. She is married with children.  Yvrose would like to use this loan to to invest in the purchase on coal.  She hopes this loan will help her expand her business. The other members of the group need loans for businesses such as coal and  "ken kay". Yvrose says that her main challenge is to become a large merchant.  Yvrose lives in the region called Ferrier in Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Yvrose has run her coal business for the past 15 years.

loans.use: to buy coal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Oliver K

texts.en:
Oliver is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 5 and 10. All of them go to school.

Oliver runs a general store and has been in business for 4 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. She is taking a loan of 2,500 SDG to purchase sugar, rice, and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Oliver would like to expand her business. Her major challenge includes high prices in the market.

Oliver says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar and rice for her general store

loans.name: Ahadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bahati est doyenne du groupe Ahadi, entrepreneur, âgée de 58 ans, vendeuse de pièces de rechange (moto, vélo, véhicules, engins,). Elle s’entraide avec son mari. Elle est mère de 5 enfants, ayant tous finis leurs étudient universitaires et ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de payer d’autres pièces à mettre dans son stock (pistons, disque, chambre à air, bourrages, pneus, huile moteur, etc.). la cliente est confortable avec le programme de Hekima. Il sied de signaler une cliente est venu avec son fils.
texts.en: Bahati is the oldest member of the Ahadi group. She is an entrepreneur, 58- years old, and a seller of spare parts (motorcycle, bicycle, vehicles, engines)  She and her husband help each other.  She is mother of five children, all of whom have finished university and already have their own families.  This new loan will enable her to pay for spare parts to add to her inventory (pistons, discs, air chambers, stuffing, tires, motor oil, etc.) The borrower is comfortable with Hekima's program.  It is worth noting that the borrower came with her son.

loans.use: to buy parts (pistons, discs, air chambers, stuffing, tires, motor oil, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr: La cliente Simisi est la présidente du groupement d’affaire Faida, entrepreneur de hautement expérimentée, elle est mariée et mère de 4 jeunes enfants et de nombreux petits fils et filles. Son mari est sans emploi et demeure trop maladif suite à l’état de vieillesse. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers. Elle commença son entreprise avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 20 cycles dans le programme de micro crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 40 paires de souliers. Les profits de sa micro entreprise lui servent de suppléer aux divers besoins (scolarité, soins médicaux, aliment, habillement, etc.) de son ménage dit-elle. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes
texts.en: The borrower, Simisi, is President of the Faida business group.  She is a very experienced entrepreneur, married, and mother of four children and many grandsons and granddaughters.  Her husband is unemployed and remains too sickly due to old age.  The borrower is a seller of shoes.  She started her business with a loan from IMF Hekima.  She just completed her 20th cycle in Hekima's microcredit program. This new loan will enable her to buy 40 pairs of shoes.  The profits from her business will allow her to take care of various household needs (school fees, medical care, food, clothing, etc.)  She thanks Hekima for their support and empowerment of female entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 40 pairs of shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: El Fresno De La Soledad Group

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene 61 años de edad el está casado con la señora  Angelina, con el vive una hija la cual estudia una escuela técnica en enfermería y dos nietos que mantiene ya que le ayuda a una de sus hijas con los gastos de sus niños. El pertenece a un grupo que se llama El Fresno de la Soledad y dice que le pusieron ese nombre por que donde hacen sus reuniones había un árbol de fresno y como la comunidad se llama La Soledad decidieron juntar los dos nombres y ponerle así al grupo para que les fuera más fácil a ellos aprenderse el nombre de su grupo. Dice que él tiene una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes desde hace 8 años y que la puso para poder estar más al pendiente de su familia y de su casa, también se dedica al cultivo de aguacate y maíz el cual sale a venderlo a la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de él. Dice que el surte sus productos que vende en diferentes tiendas y que dos veces por semana.
Platica que puso su tienda para mejorar la economía de su casa y porque cerca de ahí no hay tiendas bien surtidas como la de él y trata de tener todo lo indispensable para su venta. Dice que ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de huevo aunque ahorita subió mucho de precio pero es el producto que le piden mas, así como azúcar, jabón, leche, cloro, sal, aceite, maizcena, arroz, frijol, chiles, mayonesa, jamón, salchicha, pan empaquetado, papel higiénico, toallas femeninas, etc. El quiere mejorar su tienda porque no quiere perder a sus clientes ya que es la mejor tienda de su comunidad. Dice que también él quiere comprar un poco  de abonos e insecticidas para mejorar sus árboles de aguacate ya que tiene que tenerlos muy bien protegidos por que pronto se vendrán las fuertes heladas y tiene que comprarles buenos abonos para que no se quemen. Los otros cinco integrantes del grupo se llaman Francisca, Omar, Rogelio, Felipe y Luis Antonio ellos invertirán sus créditos en planta de aguacate y abonos, frutas y legumbres de temporada e insumos para huertas de aguacate para su venta.
texts.en:
Don Juan is 61 and married to Señora  Angelina. Living with them are one daughter who studying nursing in college and two grandchildren. They help one of their daughters to support her children. Juan belongs to a group called El Fresno de la Soledad [The Ash Tree of La Soledad]. He says that they chose this name because there was an ash tree near their meeting place, and because their community is called La Soledad, and they decided to join the names together to name their group so that it would be easier to remember. He says that he has had a small grocery store for eight years, and that he opened it so that he could better help his family and his household. He also cultivates avocado and corn, which he sells at a supply center in a nearby village. He says that he sells his products twice a week to various other stores. He tells us that he opened his store in order to improve his household income and because there are no well-stocked stores like his in the area. He tries to have all the basic staples in his store for sale. He says that he is now requesting a loan for the purchase of eggs, even though the price of eggs has gone up quite a bit, because it is his most popular product. He will also buy sugar, soap, milk, bleach, salt, oil, cornmeal, rice, beans, chilli, mayonnaise, ham, sausage, bread, toilet paper, feminine products, etc. He wants to improve his store because he cannot afford to lose customers. His store is the best store in the community. He says that he also wants to buy some fertilizer and insecticides in order to improve his avocado trees, since he has to keep them very well-protected against the strong frost that is coming. He also needs to buy good fertilizers that won't burn the plants. 
The other five group members are called Francisca, Omar, Rogelio, Felipe and Luis Antonio. They will invest their loans in the planting of avocado, in fertilizer, in seasonal fruits and vegetables, and in other supplies for growing avocados for sale.

loans.use: to stock up on items for his grocery store and for supplies for cultivating avocado.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en: Ibraheem is 23 years old, and from Gaza. He has owned a mini grocery store since 2008. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator, some goods, and display shelves. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income, so that he can continue his higher education in the university.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, some goods, and display shelves.

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es: Doña Olga tiene 51 años de edad y está casada con el señor Alejandro el cual es albañil, ella es parte de un grupo llamado Mariposas platica que es la primera vez que trabajan con Visión Fund y que están muy contentos todos los integrantes ella dice “hicimos nuestro grupo porque todos ocupamos capital para invertir en nuestros negocios, anduvimos preguntando en varias financieras pero ninguna nos convenció como Visión Fund ya que es la que más bajos intereses tiene y decidimos trabajar con esta empresa”. Platica que ella a diario trabaja haciendo tortillas con una señora que aproximadamente hace al día unos 50 docenas de tortillas a mano equivalente a unas 600 tortillas y que trabaja de lunes a sábado para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar aunque a ella le gustaría trabajar por su propia cuenta y tener un negocio estable, dice que le gustaría vender tortillas en su casa y está pidiendo un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de colchas, sabanas, cobertores, toallas, edredones por catalogo, le platico una amiga que se tienen buenas ganancias en la venta de blancos y ella espera que le vaya muy bien ya que compró los catálogos y ya le han hecho varios pedidos ahora nada mas le falta el capital para surtir sus pedidos. Dice que los venderá en pagos para así se les haga más fácil a las clientes el pagar y ella poder recuperar poco a poco. Olga está muy contenta porque dice que le echara muchas ganas para poder hacer su negocio propio tanto de elaboración de tortillas y venta de blancos. Los otros 7 integrantes del grupo se llaman Feliza, Leticia, Ma. Guadalupe, Ana Ma. Arsenia, Juan y Sonia ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de refacciones para carros, en frutas y legumbres de temporada, en zapatos para dama de temporada, en la compra de zapatos por catalogo para vender, en la compra de ropa por catalogo para vender, en dulces para su venta.
texts.en:
Olga is 51 years old, and married to Alejandro, who works in construction. She is part of a group called "Mariposas." 

She says that it is the first time they have worked with Visión Fund, and that all the members are very happy. She says, "We formed our group because we all need working capital to invest in our businesses. We went around asking several financial institutions, but none convinced us like Visión Fund, as it is the one with the lowest interest rates, and we decided to work with this institution." 

She says that she works every day making tortillas with a woman who makes approximately 50 dozen tortillas a day by hand, the equivalent of some 600 tortillas. She works from Monday to Saturday to be able to help her husband with the household expenses, even though she would like to be self-employed and have a stable business. 

She says she would like to sell tortillas from her home. Currently, she is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of mattresses, sheets, bed coverings, towels and comforters by catalog. 

A friend told her that good earnings can be made selling bedding, and she hopes that it will go very well, as she bought the catalogs and people have already made several orders with her. Now all she needs is working capital to supply the orders. She says that she will sell on a payment plan, to make it easier for the customers to pay, and for her to gradually recover her investment. 

Olga is very happy, because she is really looking forward to having her own business, both making tortillas and selling bedding. 

The other members of the group are Feliza, Leticia, Maria Guadalupe, Anna Maria Arsenia, Juan and Sonia. They will invest their loans in the purchase of goods to sell: car parts, seasonal fruits and vegetables, seasonal women shoes, shoes by catalog, clothing by catalog, and candy.

loans.use: To buy mattresses, sheets, bedcovers, towels, and comforters by catalog for her sales business.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lenie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs. Lenie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF, to purchase additional fish for her fish vending business.

Lenie  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.en:
Tarcila is 45 years old and married with one child currently going to school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Tarcila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Tarcila requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Tarcila has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Tarcila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy items like shampoo and groceries, to sell in her store.

NWTF is re-listing Ma. Chona's business profile for this new loan, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries, to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a 27-year-old married woman with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and has been in service for a period of six years. With her meager salary, she has been able to buy land and pay school fees for the children.

After realizing that her salary could not sustainably support the family, she decided to venture into poultry farming, and her dream is to have at least 3,000 birds. Flavia is requesting a loan to buy chicks for her poultry project.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her poultry project.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en: Nathaniel is a well-known merchant, who is still selling phone accessories in the store. He has established a good base of regular customers. His customers like him because of his perfect work, in addition to his inexpensive products that are original and of high quality. Nathaniel is currently asking for another loan to use to pay school fees for his son. He has the urge to continue to be in business.  He is thankful for the loans he is getting from Kiva and Yehu. They have been of help to him.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his son.

loans.name: Ideagwa Eneriko

texts.en:
Ideagwa is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 8; two of them go to school.

Ideagwa runs a general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. She is taking a loan of 1,600 sdg (Sudan pounds) to purchase tomatoes, rice and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Ideagwa would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Ideagwa says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, rice, etc.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihas is a 62-year-old married man from Gaza. He has owned a grocery store since 2008 in which he sells different kinds of food, home appliances, drinks, and candies; this helps him make ends meet for him and his wife.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a refrigerator and develop the space of the grocery store. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and develop the space of the grocery store.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es: Dora Elia tiene 31 años de edad y es originaria de una localidad llamada Macutzio donde su principal actividad es el cultivo de hortalizas y cultivo de  flor de noche buena, ella es parte del grupo Las Divinas y dice que le pusieron ese nombre por que cuando abrieron su grupo estaba de moda una novela donde salían unas chicas llamadas las divinas y para que su nombre del grupo sonara bien le decidieron poner ese nombre “Dora se ríe vergonzosamente cuando dice el nombre del grupo” platica que ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas reafirmantes, exfoliantes, hidratantes para la piel, cosméticos como rubores, maquillajes en polvo y liquido, pintura de uñas y artículos para el hogar ya que trabaja con 3 empresas que venden por catalogo, dice que tiene con su negocio desde hace siete años y que le gusta trabajar en lo que hace porque así a conocido a mucha gente de otras comunidades y también puede estar al pendiente de su casa ya que tiene 3 hijos y está casada con paulino el cual se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas. Comenta que esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de los artículos que le piden sus clientes y dice que ya tiene varios en espera ya que ahorita no tiene capital para surtir ya que les vende a sus clientes por pagos. Dora dice que surte sus productos en distribuidores autorizados ya que le dan bajos costos de los que surte y también quisiera vender colchas por catalogo. Ella dice “me gustaría también vender las colchas para así poder aportar un poco más a mi hogar y asi poder comprarles a mis hijos lo que ocupen para su educación, hay veces que no se puede comprar todo a la vez es por eso que le estoy echando muchas ganas para poder comprarles ropa y zapatos nuevos y no se segunda mano como suelo comprarles ya que no me alcanza abeces y sonríe tímidamente”. Las otras tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Rosalinda la cual invertirá su crédito en la compra de ropa para damas y caballeros, María Guadalupe ella invertirá en surtir hilos, marquice, agujas, estambre para la elaboración de manteles, servilletas, almohadones etc. para su venta y Victoria que ella invertirá su crédito en surtir colchas y zapatos de diferentes marcas por catalogo.
texts.en:
Dora Elia is 31 years old and is a native of a community called Macutzio, where her main occupation is cultivating vegetables and growing poinsettias. She is a member of the Las Divinas Communal Bank and says that they gave it that name because when they started the group a very popular serial started about some girls called Las Divinas and the group thought it sounded good and decided to name themselves that. Dora laughs a bit ashamed when she says the name of the group.

She says that she sells perfume for women and men, firming creams, scrubs, skin moisturizers, cosmetics, such as blush, powder and liquid makeup, nail polish and household items. She works for three companies and sells by catalog. She has had this business for seven years and enjoys the work because she meets many people from other communities and she can also take care of her home since she has three children and is married to Paulino, who farms vegetables. 

Dora is requesting a loan in order to purchase items her customers have requested. She says she already has various things on order since right now she does not have the capital for supplies because she sells to her customers on credit.
