Nsubuga is a 23-year-old married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. After dropping out of school due to lack of school fees, she decided to set up a salon. She also sells clothes  and she got start up capital from her husband. She has a personal goal of educating her children and building a permanent house since she is currently living in a rented house while her business plan is to achieve a modern salon.

Nsubuga is requesting a loan to buy synthetic hair extensions and clothes to sell in the salon.

loans.use: to buy synthetic hair extensions  and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nassiri

texts.en:
Nassiri's goal is to improve his spare parts retail shop business and to respond to the demands of the market, but his working capital stands as a large impediment to achieving his goals. 

Currently, he is applying for a micro-loan, with which he will expand his shop business and purchase more spare parts. From there, he will really begin his road to achieving his greatest goal of becoming a wholesale supplier of spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah sells footwear at Asebu Brebia. Sarah has been selling this for the past five years.

She is single and has three children. As a single parent, she is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying school fees for her children. 

She will use her loan to purchases footwear for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her footwear.

loans.use: to purchase footwear for sale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia sells saucepans, bowls, and and other cooking utensils at Asebu near Cape Coast. She has done this for two years now. 

She is married, and her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills.  

Lydia  will use her loan to purchase more saucepans,bowls, plastic bowls, cooking utensils, etc., to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans, bowls, plastic bowls, cooking utensils  to sell.

loans.name: Mo'men

texts.en:
Mo'men is a 21-year-old from Gaza.
He owns a workshop for repairing and painting cars since 2009 and has two employees who help him.
He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a compressor and a new car-painting machine.
He hopes that this loan will help him develop his workshop and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and a new car-painting machine.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma used his previous Kiva loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.  His business has done very well.  He is applying for a loan to expand to a wholesale business to earn more profits in his business. His goal is to attain a larger expansion of his market to reach higher sales than currently.

With the new Kiva loan he’s applying for, he will add stock of sacks of rice, sugar and wheat flour. His message for Kiva lenders is the following: “Continue helping small businesses to improve their income.”

loans.use: To purchase added stock of sacks of rice, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis  is married and has eight children. He has received schooling through form 4. Francis sells charcoal  and firewood  at Asebu Brebia, which he has done  for  5 years now. His wife is a trader. Francis uses his income to pay for his children’s school fees.  Francis will use the loan to purchase an acacia plantation for firewood and produce charcoal. With the new profits, Francis hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase an acacia plantation for  firewood for sale and  to produce charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba produces gari, a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava. Araba sells the gari at Asebu near Cape Coast. She has done this for five years now. 

She is married to a farmer and has five children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills. 

Araba will use her loan to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells charcoal at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for two years now. 

Efua is a single parent and has four children. She uses her income to feed her children and pay their school fees.  

Efua will use her loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Efua wants to produce the charcoal  she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Las Albercas Group

texts.es: Doña Margarita tiene 54 años y es originaria de San Felipe de los Alzati una localidad donde su principal economía es el cultivo de flor de noche buena y en estos meses son los fuertes para los productores ya que buscan compradores en México a nivel nacional y en otros países para su venta. Margarita es parte de esos productores que año con año hacen ver hermosa la navidad con flores de noche buena espectaculares de diferentes colores, tamaños y especies, ella platica “me siento orgullosa de pertenecer a estas tierras ricas en naturaleza es muy bonito trabajar con la flor mas pedida en diciembre ya que representa la natividad del niño Dios”. Ella desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica a la producción de flor de noche buena y aunque han bajado drásticamente las ventas ya que mucha gente de la región se dedica al cultivo sigue trabajando con la flor ya que es muy buen negocio aunque se le invierta demasiado tiempo y capital, ella ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de abonos, pintura para pintar los viveros y no pinten tan rápido las flores y estén en buen estado y papel por que en menos de un mes empieza la venta en grande, dice que van compradores de todo el país y turistas del extranjero ya que cerca de su localidad como a 20 minutos se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca y en los meses de diciembre arriban las mariposas. Dice que ella maneja diferentes variedades de flores como son la suljibri, japonesa o china, mármol, marble star, monet, prestige, blanca, freedom, salmón, sonora. Dice que su meta es comprar una camioneta con la cual pueda transportar sus flores y venderlas en otros estados del país para no pagar flete ya que sale algo caro. Las otras cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Diana, Erika, María Teresa y Florinda ellas invertirán sus créditos para la compra de insumos para sus viveros de noche buena.
texts.en:
Doña Margarita is 54 years old and is a native of San Felipe de los Alzati, a town whose principal economy is the cultivation of poinsettias, which is a strong crop for producers during these months, because they are looking for buyers in Mexico at the national level and to other countries for their sales. Margarita is one of those producers who, year after year, makes Christmas look beautiful with spectacular poinsettias of different sizes, colors and varieties. She says, “I am proud to belong to this bountiful land; it is lovely to work with the flower that is most requested in December because it represents the birth of baby Jesus.”

She has been growing poinsettias for more than 10 years and, although sales have dropped drastically because so many people in the region also cultivate the flowers, she continues working because it is still a good business, although she invests too much time and capital in it. Right now she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and paint for the greenhouses so the flowers will not mature too quickly and will be in good condition. She also will buy decorative paper because the big sales will begin in less than a month. She says that buyers from all over the country and abroad are coming because about 20 minutes away from her town there is a Monarch butterfly sanctuary and in December, the butterflies arrive.

Margarita says she grows different varieties of poinsettias such as the Japanese, Chinese, Marbel, Marbel Star, etc. She says that her goal is to buy a van to use to transport her flowers and sell them in other states of the country so she will not have to pay freight because it is a bit expensive. 

The four other members of the group are Diana, Erika, Maria Teresa and Florinda. They will also invest their loans to buy supplies for their nursery beds of poinsettias.

loans.use: to buy paper, fertilizer and pay to ship the flowers.

loans.name: Ekow

texts.en:
Ekow Nuamah is a farmer. He has completed middle school form four. He is single. 

Ekow cultivates cassava for sale at Asebu Brebia and also sells firewood. He has been doing this for 15 years now. He uses his income to pay his utility and accommodation bills.   

He will use his loan to hire labour to work in his farm. Ekow plans to expand his farm with the new profits.

loans.use: to hire labour to work in his farm.

loans.name: Kavata

texts.en:
Kavata is very enthusiastic about the growth of her food-stall business. She works every day, doing her best to increase her clientele; and she has managed to do so. Her greatest challenge is that her working capital is insufficient to meet her projected market demand.

This is precisely the need she would resolve with her Kiva loan, her fifth loan with the Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use it to buy rice, wheat flour and maize flour to supplement her food stock and have a greater range of products to meet her customers' greatest needs.

Her dream is to succeed in expanding her business and to keep it stocked at all times with enough food products. While this is happening, she works tirelessly to manage her accounts receivable and a rapid turnover of her stock, which she is managing to invest in, although not in the quantities she aims to have.

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat flour and maize flour to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 45-year-old man. He is married and a father to two sons and one daughter; all of them are school students and his wife is a housewife.

For the past four years, Yousef has had a grocery store which has been a profitable project, but does not yet bring in enough money to cover the family's expenses and cover the costs of work.

Yousef is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new refrigerator, which he will use for preserving food and dairy at his store. This will allow him to expand the scope of his work, improve his business, and increase the family's income.

Yousef is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator to save keep and dairy goods

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is 32 years old. He’s Lebanese and married to Maysa. He lives with her in addition to their two school-aged children. He’s trying his best to build a good future for his family especially his children. He’s responsible for covering their study fees, not to forget their heavy daily expenses. 

Houssam started to work in the construction field in the year 2000. He works on a free-lance basis and has more than a few projects to accomplish. He’s specialized at installing tiles. He’s sure that the more  projects he is able to take on, the higher his revenues will be. 

Today, he has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new tools and construction supplies for his business. He’s going to start his new project very soon, and this Kiva loan will help him accomplish his work in a good way. 

Houssam is very ambitious, awaiting the perfect time to grow in his occupation.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and construction supplies for his business

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is a friendly, Lebanese young woman. She is 21 years old. She got married few years ago and has only one child. She’s really proud to have such a united family. She is ready to do her best and offer them a respectable life. After their marriage, Hiba’s husband managed the family's expenses. When Hiba noticed that their income did not satisfy their needs, she decided to open her own clothing shop with a small amount of money she already had. She sells a wide variety of clothes from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. Today, she’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to increase her stock, especially with winter clothing.  This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income.

loans.use: To increase her stock and buy winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua  is a single parent and has seven dependents. She uses her uses her income to feed, cloth and pay school fees for her children.

Ekua is a fish monger and also cooks rice for sale at Asebu Brebia near Cape Coast. She has done this for 10 years. Ekua will use the loan to purchase fish, bags of rice and vegetables to prepare and sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, bags of rice and vegetables to prepare and sell.

loans.name: Asani

texts.en:
Asani is a married man who lives in Mwambalazi, Kenya with his wife and seven children, ages between 12 and 25 years, respectively. 

He works in a retail shop selling stall, a business that he started 20 years ago. Currently, his business has a weekly-day inventory turnover because his product is purchased daily. He sells daily to his client base which is made up of neighbors and passersby and from there they go from business to business to sell bread throughout the city. His profit is still very small, but the volume of sales allows him to sustain his business and expand to other municipalities. His biggest challenge is insufficient working capital to achieve growth. That is why he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first funding from Kiva Field Partner, Yehu Microfinance Trust. He will use the loan to buy basic ingredients such as wheat flour, butter, eggs and cheese, thereby increasing his productive capacity and thus his income. 

His dream for the future is that his children should achieve a personal and professional education.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients such as wheat flour, butter, eggs and cheese.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Josephine is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her salon where she does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair extensions and hair chemicals and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and pay for basic needs for her child like clothes and medical bills. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her child. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more hair extensions and hair chemicals

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari is a wonderful, enterprising man. He is the driving force behind his family. 

His business is operating as retail, selling coconuts to his neighbors. Through his hard work he built up a strong demand for his products, and he has gradually been expanding and making a better income to reinvest in the items necessary to strengthen the business. 

Today he lives at his own family house. His family members are also involved.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
This is the third Kiva loan that Mwanamisi has requested from Yehu Microfinance Trust because she needs to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar and to diversify to selling cashew nuts. At the moment, she does not have enough working capital to increase her sales because she buys on a daily basis and in small quantities. 

Her goal is to have a grocery in the market, where she will be helped by her husband, and which would give her higher income so that she could keep improving the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cashew nuts.

loans.name: Nihal

texts.en:
Nihal, who appears in the photo, is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to two sons and one daughter. Nihal is a housewife and her husband is a worker who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Nihal wants to expand her small house and provide a comfortable life for her family, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing necessary construction supplies to start building the room on the roof of the house. Adding this room to the house will provide a decent life for Nihal and her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to build a room on the roof of the house

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar, who appears in the picture, is a 30-year-old young man. He is married and a father to two daughters. His wife is a housewife. Omar works as a salesman in a local company for the distribution of water filters and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's need.

Omar's brother is studying at the university in Egypt, specializing in dentistry. Omar wants to help his brother to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help his brother cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for his brother and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay the higher education costs

loans.name: Maulid

texts.en:
Maulid is from the location of Mwambalazi. He drives a motorcycle taxi. He is married and has worked as a taxi driver for 4 years. He lived with his parents and decided to come live in the city, thinking of his own progress and that of his family.

He remarks that his job is very difficult because during the rainy season, he has a lot of obstacles since he has fewer passengers since it's cold. His dream is to buy more motorcycles to work and thus progress over every day.

He is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi since it is an essential part of his job. He is happy with this opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Raouf

texts.en:
Raouf is a 44-year-old married man, father of two children. He has been working in the tailoring business for 31 years. In 1991, he opened his own business to improve his living and increase his income.

He applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay his children's tuition fees, do necessary maintenance on his car, and buy newly released fabrics. This will be his ninth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with good standing and a good paying-back history.

His wide experience and accuracy in his business, attracted a lot of customers and spread his reputation among a lot of retail drapery dealers. Raouf hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can to complete most of his customers' requests.

loans.use: to pay his children's tuition fees, do necessary maintenance on his car, and buy newly released fabrics

loans.name: Jessy

texts.en:
Jessy is a 20-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and six siblings. Four of them are working to be able to bring added income to the family. Her father is the one responsible for covering the family expenses. 

Despite her young age and unlike other ladies, Jessy wanted to have her own business. She opened her own call center in her town. Today, she’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge her business and purchase some products such as recharge cards and other needed items. This will boost her business and thus her profits. In the future, she hopes to take more Kiva loans and better develop her work.

loans.use: to enlarge her business and purchase some products such as recharge cards and other needed items

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman, aged 45, with two children between the ages of 2 and 18. She sells clothes as retail at the market and from home. 

Her customers comprise her neighbors, family and referred customers. Her business is an important source of income for her household, as is the income her husband earns through his farming produce sales. 

Mwanasha always tries to meet her customers’ demands. Her dream for the future is to open a store to the general public and to diversify to other businesses. While she builds on her dream, she will continue to make an effort to find sales that will increase her income. She would like to generate a profit margin of no less than 35 per cent and to keep an inventory rotation schedule of 10 days. 

Her Kiva loan is her first with Yehu Microfinance Trust (a Kiva field partner). With it she plans to purchase bales of clothes for resale. Her clients have placed orders, and this predicts a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 45-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and only one school-aged child. She’s a friendly and above all a hard-working woman. She started her business as a tailor many years ago; she’s very talented at her job especially after more than twenty years of experience in the same occupation. People in her town and the surrounding areas are sure that she can offer them high quality designs at fair prices.  

At the same time, she owns another shop and benefits from its rental fees. In order to provide the family with extra financial support, her husband also works and has his own business. With her requested loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l, Nadia will purchase new textiles designs and different types of needles and thread in addition to many other items. She seeks to open her own tailoring factory as soon as she can, hoping to enhance her family’s way of living.

loans.use: to purchase new textile designs and different types of needles and thread in addition to many other items

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija has five children who all attend school. She sells used clothing from her home in the neighborhood of Mwambalazi. Thanks to her work, she has been able to provide her children an education and buy everything she needs for her home. 

Khadija has always demonstrated hard work in her business. This is the first loan she has requested from Yehu Microfinance. She wants to buy clothing so that she can restock her business and offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He has owned a cafe in his town since 2009. He’s the main income provider for the family and looking to offer them a good standard of living. And even though he’s spending most of his time working, he still believes that this is the perfect way to enhance his family’s way of living and help his children achieve a higher educational level.

 Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his café’s interior decoration and purchase the needed quantity of coffee, charcoal for the hubble-bubble, and many other items. He notes that this will boost his work and improve his status financially. In the future, he plans to add food to his café.

loans.use: to renovate his café’s interior decoration and purchase the needed quantity of coffee, charcoal for the hubble-bubble and many other items

loans.name: Sadije

texts.en:
Sadije is forty-six years old. She is married and has two children, ages fourteen and twenty-six. Neither she nor her husband works at this time. In her family only her daughter works and she works in a cake shop. This wonderful and loving family lives in unacceptable conditions. 

During the rainy season and in wintertime, they have a serious problem with  windows and doors. Sadije’s family are requesting a loan in order to renovate their house and to buy windows and doors, replacing the old ones with new ones. This loan will help them to have better conditions for their lives. 

Sadije is grateful to Kiva lenders for improving the family's living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To renovate their house and to buy windows and doors

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira runs a household products store. She's married and has five children. She started the business to be able to have a source of income to support her family and cover all the most basic necessities.

She wants to invest in new products to diversify the store, so she's requesting a loan to buy balers of maize and wheat flour, rice, sugar, and other fast selling products. This will allow her to have more inventory and be her customers' preference, and so increase her profits.

Her goal is to improve her family's quality of life and be able to continue working in her business, making it more profitable all the time.

loans.use: to invest in new products to diversify her store

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is 32 years old and married to Ali. They have four children, all of whom attend school. Previously they were mobile vendors, and Biasha dedicated herself to her cereals business. With great effort they were able to open their own shop, which currently has numerous customers in the area.

Biasha attends her shop and her husband dedicates himself to construction. Both are making great efforts to get ahead and to help their children, since they want them to finish their studies and become successful people.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, vegetables, bulk foods, and other basic products. She is grateful for this opportunity which she is receiving, since it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, bulk foods, and other basic products.

loans.name: Abdelkareem

texts.en:
AbdelKareem is a 41-year-old man. He is married and a father to three sons and three daughters. His wife is a housewife. He is a services employee at a local university in the city where he lives, but the low salary he earns isn't enough to cover all of the family's needs.

For the past four years, AbdelKareem has had a sewing workshop for sewing clothes for customers, which has been a profitable project and a second source of income to the family.

AbdelKareem is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing additional thread and fabrics to meet the increasing customers' demand and to provide better quality to his loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve AbdelKareem's income.

AbdelKareem is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: to purchase thread and fabrics

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 37 years old and a father of three children. He has a phone repair business in Nakuru town. He is married to Grace, who works in the poultry industry. Apart from phones repair, he also sell phones and phone accessories.

This is his first loan term, and he plans to use the amount to buy phone accessories for use and to sell in his business. He will use the generated profits to buy more stocks of mobile phones and phone accessories.

Solomon hopes to grow his business by becoming a phone supplier and dealer, hence making more income and improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to add to his stock of phone accessories.

loans.name: Rola

texts.en:
Rola is a 33-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son and one daughter.

For the past four years, Rola and her husband have had a grocery store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs.

Rola is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar, canned food and dairy products. This will increase sales and increase the family's income.

Rola and her husband are photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase needed stock of basic groceries

loans.name: Ngeno

texts.en:
Ngeno is aged 24. He is a farmer in Litein County in Kenya, where he has been in farming for three years, producing milk and tea, which he sells locally. He has a motorbike that helps him in transporting the milk to his clients.

He is requesting a 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan from Juhudi Kilimo  to purchase milk pans that will help him in distributing his milk production easily. He aspires to have ventured into dairy farming fully by building a modern dairy unit and acquiring other quality dairy cows in the near future. This will assist him to generate more income and improve his livelihood.

Lack of enough dairy feeds and diseases are some of his major challenges in dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase milk pans

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: This is the third loan that Selina has requested from Yehu Microfinance Trust because she needs to buy more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice. At the moment, she does not have enough working capital to increase her sales because she buys on a daily basis and in small quantities. Her goal is to have a wholesale shop in town, where she will be helped by her husband. A shop would give her a higher income so that she could keep improving the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase household goods, wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has a cosmetics and beauty shop in Naivasha town and has operated it for one year. He is 26 years old, married to Monica and they have two children.

This is his first loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of cosmetics and beauty products to sell in his business. These include body lotion, sprays, hair shampoo as well as jewelry.

He hopes to grow his business by opening more cosmetics and beauty shops in various places. He also hopes to make more income from the business and be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 32 years old and is a very hardworking woman. She and her children have been living in Mwambalazi for the past 2 years.

Charity has a retail store in her neighborhood. She started with a few items and began to increase with the help of the loans she got through Yehu Microfinance and through her own savings. She says that her work requires a lot of sacrifice because only she and her husband work out of the whole family. Her dream is to set up a supermarket in her neighborhood.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy food products, noodles, breads, rice and other supplies that make up her greatest sales.

loans.use: to buy food products, noodles, breads, rice and other supplies

loans.name: Winnie Njoki

texts.en:
Winnie used her previous loan amount to buy potatoes, carrots and onions to sell in her business and it has been profitable. Besides the milk and vegetable business, she also plants cash crops such as beans and maize to sell.

This being her second loan term, she plans to use the amount to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and maize seeds for planting on her farm. She also plans to use part of the amount to pay school fees for her children.

Winnie hopes to grow her business and make more income so to be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay school fees

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred has a grocery business in Olkalau town and has operated the business for five years. She is 49 years old and a single mother of three children.

This is her first loan term, and she plans to use the amount to buy cabbages, spinach, tomatoes, onions and fruits such as pineapple, oranges and bananas to sell in her business.

She hopes to grow her business, make more income and thereby be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti, 38, has had a grocery store for 10 years, and it has a well-formed clientele from her neighborhood and adjacent areas. It’s a constant sacrifice for her because she has to rise at dawn to make her purchases and meet the customer demand.

Mwanasiti comments that her dream is to be able to enlarge the business for greater customer comfort and so that she can continue to grow.

She requests the loan to buy food items, beverages, sugar, maize flour and other items to stock her store since these are essential for her customers.

loans.use: to buy food items, beverages, sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is from Mwambalazi location. She is 30 years old, married to Charo and they have four children who are still young, but who are the couple's reason to struggle for success.

Kwekwe has a business selling fruits and vegetables at the town market. She occupies two stands. She has a fixed customer base, good income and good business and personal references. She is a hardworking woman and an excellent client.

She is asking for this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables to stock her store with products to be able to continue giving her customers the quality they expect from her.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 52 years old, and a father of six children. He is a dairy farmer in Olkalau town and has been in the business for 20 years. His wife, Rachael, is also a farmer.

This is his third loan term from KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow. This will enable him to increase his milk production and thereby meet his customer's demands. He anticipates to make more profits with which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

Thomas hopes to improve his farming methods, make more income, and be able to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is dedicated to her business, selling fruits and vegetables. Having a good quantity of clients has helped her to increase her income and thanks to this, she has now been able to work toward her aspiration of building a house.

She has received a loan from our institution that she has used for the purchase of fruits and vegetables and this loan that she is now requesting will enable her construct a residential house. She will buy blocks, cement, and sand.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer in Olkalau town and has been in the farming business for two years. He is 28 years old and married to Elizabeth. They have two children aged four and two. Besides farming, he also has a business where he sells cereals such as maize, beans and wheat.

This is his second loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and maize seeds for planting on his farm. He also plans to buy more stock of wheat, rice and green gram (mung beans) for sell in his cereals business. He will use the generated income to pay school fees for his children.

Peter hopes to grow his business, make more income, and buy a plot to build rental houses. He also hopes to buy a lorry for transporting farm produce to various markets in the region.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and maize seeds.

loans.name: Albertirne

texts.en:
Albertirne, 34, stopped her education in the 7th grade, and is single with two children, 4 and 8, who are in school. For the past three years, she has been selling soft drinks in her community. She make profit when she sells because her soft drink are always cold to quench the thirst of her customers. She is proud of this business because she feels self reliant. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more soft drinks and increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to give her children higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and increase her sales.

loans.name: Aisalkyn

texts.ru:
Айсалкын 55 лет, разведена. Вырастила двух сыновей. Оба сына женаты. Старший  сын уехал  работать в Россию. Младший сын помогает матери. Айсалкын закончила торговый техникум. 
Сейчас Айсалкын занимается реализацией женской одежды  на местном рынке. Свой бизнес она начала с 10,000 сом. Ежемесячный доход Айсалкын составляет около 20,000 сом. По характеру человек очень честный и целеустремленный. Все что она добилась, оставаясь одна с двумя её детьми, благодаря её трудолюбию. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на  увеличение товарооборота за счет покупки зимнего ассортимента утепленных вещей. Айсалкын обратилась в  седьмой раз в компанию «Бай Тушум и партнеры»  за кредитом. Кредитная история заемщика очень хорошая.
texts.en:
Aisalkyn is 55 and divorced with two sons. Both of her sons are married. Her older son is a migrant worker in Russia, and her younger son is helping his mother. 
Aisalkyn graduated from a trade vocational school. She currently sells women's clothes at a local market. She started this business with 10,000 KGS. Aisalkyn's monthly income is around 20,000 KGS. 
She is a very honest and determined person. A single mother with two children, she achieved success thanks to her hard work.
To expand her business, she has requested a loan of 100,000 KGS from Bai Tushum & Partners. Aisalkyn will expand her sales by buying a selection of warm winter clothes.
This is the seventh time Aisalkyn has taken out a loan from Bai Tushum & Partners. Her credit history is excellent.

loans.use: to expand sales

loans.name: Fatuma's Group

texts.en:
Fatuma's group is comprised of 3 hard-working women. Fatuma is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her brick business, which makes and sells bricks. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda (her portion of the 1,900,000 Shilling loan). The loan will be used to buy more materials for making bricks (like firewood for baking the bricks) and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and pay for her medical bills. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house for herself and own a retail shop. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bricks such as firewood for baking the bricks

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 32 years old and has been doing a bicycle transport business in Nakuru town for a year now. He is married to Phanice and they have two children.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use the amount to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. This will enable him to serve more customers as well as transport more goods to the market place where most of his customers work from.

In the future, Gabriel hopes to buy more motorcycles for his transport business and make more income; hence being able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 55 years old. She is a widow and has five children. She lives in her own home in a very calm neighborhood.

Rehema operates a cereals shop, selling household consumables. She continues to work in the business because it is doing very well. She has a good customer base and has reasonable prices.

She has requested a loan to buy products in bulk like cooking oil for frying, starch, milk, corn flour, etc.

loans.use: to buy products in bulk like cooking oil, starch, milk, corn flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Kimemia

texts.en:
Kimemia, a farmer in Olkalau town, used his previous loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting. It was profitable and he was able to pay back all of the loan amount in good time.

This being his third loan term, he plans to use the amount to buy fertilizer, maize and potato seeds for planting. Due to the high demand for potatoes and maize in the region, he anticipated to make more profits with which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

Kimemia hopes to grow his farming business by investing in zero grazing. He also hopes to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity, 39, lives with her life companion and seven children in her own house. She sells home products like detergents and in addition sells herbal medicine from a small store located in her home. She sells from place to place and also from home. She’s gained much experience during the years she’s worked and has acquired a good clientele who prefer her because of the quality, good prices and excellent service. Purity is noted for her great kindness; she’s a woman who is dedicated to her work and is energetic and tenacious. She knows that even if it’s difficult, reaching her dreams after much effort will be the greatest reward.

The loan she is currently asking for will be used to buy more herbal medicines and detergents.

loans.use: to buy more herbal medicines and detergents.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 34 years old. She is married to Bedan and together they have two children. She practices farming in the Ndunyu Njeru area and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 8,000 from her business.

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends who is a registered customer. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, pesticides and to pay laborers. She will pay her children's school fees with the anticipated profits from the business.

She hopes to improve her farming and also purchase another piece of land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, pesticides and to pay laborers

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is from Mwambalazi, is a widow, and has four children. She works selling fuel and in farming. Both of her businesses help her with the maintenance of the house and in this way she gives her children what they need from day to day. She is a hardworking, responsible and very honest woman.

She began to sell her products from home and she says that her dream was always to have a big shop to sell her products. This means she could supply to a large area and from it she would get around the whole area to sell. She has a very dedicated clientele and a good monthly income. She is requesting this loan to buy containers for fuel.

loans.use: to buy containers for fuel.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma wishes to expand her business and open a new station where she will be selling fresh water. She explains that her previous loan has been of great help to her since it has enabled her to have enough savings to open this new business. However, she says that the money she currently has is not enough to cover all the costs. For this reason, she is asking for a new loan that will enable her buy a water tank and water pipes. Fatuma dreams of purchasing a motorcycle in future.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo, 34, is married and lives with her spouse, Hamisi; she’s very happy with him. She owns a small, well-stocked grocery store where she works very hard every day. She’s had her small business for 3 years and thanks to her work and sacrifice it’s been growing. She also relates that her husband always helps her in everything he can and they are growing this way. Mwanakombo requests this loan to buy milk, bread, meat, beverages and other products needed to stock the store to continue growing and providing customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, meat, beverages and other products

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet's group is comprised of hardworking women. Annet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kachwaba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, maize flour and milk. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like sugar, maize flour, soap and milk for resale, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and increase the stock that will expand the business. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to build a big house for herself. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like sugar, maize flour, soap and milk for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a thirty-eight-year-old farmer in Litein County in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and four children who are all in school. He has been in farming for ten years, producing milk and tea which he sells to the people in his local area. He aspires to have ventured into dairy farming fully in five years time.

He is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi kilimo to purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit that will help him in improving his income and paying his children's school fees.

Animal diseases and insufficient animal feed are his major challenges in dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo, aged 40, is married and has three children all whom attend primary school. Thanks to job she is doing, she is able to educate her children and purchase all the household necessities. She has proven to be responsible and honest in her commitments. Mwanakombo has her own cereals shop that she was able to purchase by working hard and using her savings from farming. She is requesting the loan to purchase sacks of rice, beans, maize flour, wheat flour, and other ingredients to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, beans, maize flour, wheat flour, and other ingredients

loans.name: Jascar

texts.en:
Jascar is 25 years old, married and with two children aged between seven and two years old. She runs a green grocery stall in Kibera, a business she has done for the last five years.

She has applied for a business loan which she plans to use to buy more stock of cereals and vegetables to sell at her stall.

She hopes that in future she can open another stall so that she can get better returns.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, and potatoes to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a cash crop farmer in Nyahururu town, where she plants maize, beans and potatoes. She is 36 years old and a single mother of six children. She has been in the farming business for nine years, and it has been profitable.

This being her first loan term, she plans to use the amount to buy fertilizer and maize seeds for planting in her farm. Due to the high demand for maize and beans in the region, she hopes to make more income, which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her farming business by planting more cash crops, such as wheat and millet, in large scale.  She hopes this will result in more income, so she will be able to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen operates a posho mill in Nyahururu town and also sells dry maize and maize flour.  She is 37 years old and married to Simon who is a farmer Together they have three children who are all in school. 

This will be her second loan. She paid back her previous loan in good time.She was introduced to KADET, LTD by a KADET field officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase maize for resale in her shop.

In the future, Helen hopes to expand her business and supply flour and maize to schools and hotels.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize for sale.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 39 years old and is married with four children aged between 5 and 15 years old. He is known for selling various goods such as African clothing, shoes, umbrellas, lotions, etc. He has two years of experience.

Celestin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more inventory of the goods he sells. With this loan, he will hopefully earn more profit, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition to that, he will continue improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as: African clothing, shoes, umbrellas, lotions, etc for resell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 43 years old. She is married to John and together they have three children aged 23 and twins aged 22. She sells clothes in her hometown, Nyahururu and has been in the business for the past year.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET field officer. This will be her second business loan from KADET LTD. She paid back her previous loan in good time. She will use the loan amount to purchase more clothes for sale in her business.

She hopes to expand her business and also start selling shoes.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 50 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living, he does horticultural farming. He has been in the business for 10 years. He also does livestock farming for more income generation. His desire is to grow his clientele for more income generation.

Cyrus has requested 5,000 KES to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa, 28, is a single mother with two children. She stopped her education in the 6th grade. Her children are between the ages of 2 and 5, and are currently in school. Hawa is very hardworking and determined to see to the well being of her children. She has been operating a shop for the past eight years where she sells cell phones and starch cards. She started first by selling cold water, and she learned to sell from her friends. She makes a profit
when she sells, because she sells fancy phones that are durable. She also uses the profits to attend to the needs of her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cell phones and starch cards for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cell phones and starch cards for the business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 38 years old, married and has three children. She runs a grocery to earn a living. She has been in the business for twelve years. Besides, she owns rental houses and sells mobile phones.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has expanded her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training her in business management skills.

Gladys hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy tomatoes and kale.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and kale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ngono

texts.en:
Ngono used her previous Kiva loan to purchase two sacks of beans and bags of maize flour for her business. Her general store business has done very well. She is currently expanding to a wholesale general store-selling business to earn more profits in her business. Her goal is to attain a larger expansion of her market to reach higher sales than currently. 

With the new Kiva loan she plans to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour. Her message for Kiva lenders is the following:  “Continue helping small businesses and improve their income.”

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 34 years old, married to Anastacia, and a father of two children, aged four and one year.

His wife works in their retail shop, while Mike makes deliveries of milk and bread. He also offers transport with his motor bike.

With this loan, he plans to add more milk from farmers for sale and also buy a stock of wheat flour and tea leaves for the shop.

Mike hopes to expand his business and invest for his family.

loans.use: to buy more milk, wheat flour, and tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 35 years old, married and has one child. She has been operating a grocery for two years and has employed two people in her business. She has learned how to save her money, thanks to Faulu Kenya for training her on financial management.

Gladys hopes to grow her business into a wholesale venture in the future.  She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy potatoes, tomatoes and cabbages.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Randu

texts.en:
Randu is known by his neighbors to be an enterprising man who is responsible and, above all, hardworking. Ten years ago, he decided to start a business selling consumer staples such as cereals, cleaning products, fruits, candies, drinks, flour, etc. 

He is 39 years old and lives in the house that he owns. He wants to propel his business forward; that is, to increase his inventory with the objective of generating a higher level of income. This will allow him to give his children better living conditions. He wants this loan so that he will be able to make the investment he wants in the wholesale purchase of merchandise for his store, including rice, beans, drinks, candy, flour, sugar, cleaning products, etc.

With this investment, he anticipates that he will be able to achieve his dream of providing for his family's basic needs, and continuing to provide daily sustenance to his children.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store, including rice, beans, drinks, candy, flour, sugar, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 34 years old. She lives with her life-partner, Nguta, and their two children in a house that they own. She buys charcoal, and sells it at retail. She has been working at this small business for several years. She has a lot of experience in this line of work. This experience allows her to get the best prices for her goods. 

Sofia's business is located in a place that is accessible and convenient for the people in her neighborhood. Many of her customers like her business, because they get good prices and service. Sofia is an enterprising, active woman with a goal to succeed. Her biggest secret to success and overcoming obstacles is her love of work. This is the only way to succeed. Sofia works every day, as only with hard work will she succeed. She would like to grow her business. In order to do this she needs working capital. That is why she is asking for a loan from Yehu, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Faraje Baco Group

texts.en:
Germaine is the leader of the Community Bank named “Faraje BACO” which is composed of 5 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Germaine has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1986. She runs a sewing workshop to the South of the city of Lubumbashi. She has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a large store in her environment. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns her US $25 per week. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. 

Germaine has already obtained and correctly repaid seven loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC. With this loan, she will increase stock of fabric and sewing accessories for her sewing workshop in order to generate more profit. 

50 years old, Germaine is single and the mother of a daughter who is 32 years old and independent.

loans.use: to increase stock of fabric and sewing accessories for her sewing workshop

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 47 years old. She is married to Joseph and the mother of ten children. She is a dairy farmer and also makes bricks. She has been in the business for the past 15 years.

This is her second loan cycle with KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET field officer. She has repaid her previous loan in good time.

She will use the loan amount to purchase dairy feed and also to pay for laborers who assist in brick making. She hopes to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed

loans.name: Charity's Group

texts.en:
Charity's group is comprised of 7 hard working women. Charity is 24 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Charity has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh food like matooke (made from green plantains). 

To help expand her business, Charity has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food like matooke, cassava and sweet potatoes for resell and will help Charity to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her younger siblings. Charity hopes that in the future she will be able to own another business. 

Charity is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food like matooke, cassava and sweet potatoes for resell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity used her previous loan to build more rental houses. She earned more income from the rental houses. She used the additional income to add stock in her retail shop.  She hopes to grow the business into wholesale.  She has requested for 59,995 KES to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Aron

texts.en:
Aron lives with his wife who is still childless. He manages a store that sells basic necessity products. He learned this business from his parents. He works there every day from seven in the morning until nine at night and has been working in this business for several years.

He needs to buy merchandise such as beans, sugar, oil, snacks, cookies, etc. that are necessary to have in the store to meet the customers' demands. Aron is asking for a loan to make this investment and help increase his inventory.

His goal with this loan is to make a good investment that will allow him to have a wider variety of products in his business and thus tend to his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as beans, sugar, oil, snacks, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
This Kiva loan is Nyamvula's third Kiva loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization through which she has acquired loans to boost her business and thus, make a better income to continue improving her family's well-being. 

With this Kiva loan, she will purchase six goats and pay for transport expenses. Her greatest challenge is that her working capital does not turn over sufficiently to cover the growing demand. With her Kiva loan, she will be able to purchase at discounted rates, in cash, and in a greater volume. With these permanent injections of capital, she will work in order to later achieve her greatest wish: to have an adequate amount of goats for sale as a wholesaler and in a good location.

loans.use: to buy six goats and pay for transport expenses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old, married and has three children. She has been selling goats to earn a living. She also does farming to generate more income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to expand her business, hence more income generation, thanks to Faulu Kenya for training her on business management skills.

Mary hopes to grow her clientele.  She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy goats.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Yuah

texts.en:
Yuah lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a security personnel. They have four children between the ages of 10 and 22. All of them are attending school and live at home.

For the past ten years, she has been selling palm oil in the local market. Sometimes she walks around with her palm oil to make a quick profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She plans to send her children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia is 53 years old, married and has five children.  To earn a living, she runs a grocery.  She has been in the business for five years.  She also does farming to earn extra income.  She appreciates the training conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills. This has helped her to improve her business.

Lusia hopes to expand her business in the future.  She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy tomatoes, carrots, bananas, and kale.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, bananas, and kale.

loans.name: Kalunde

texts.en:
Kalunde is 30 years old and married to Mutinda. She supports a family of four. She has put up a stall where she wants to set up a green grocery. Her monthly income is KES 7,500.
 
She is currently servicing her second loan from KADET LTD of KES 20,000, which will enable her to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell. 

Kalunde plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old, married and has four children. To earn a living, she runs a green grocery. She has been in the business for five years. She also sells charcoal. In addition, she depends on her husband, who is a mechanic, for financial support.

Mary hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She needs 10,000 KES to buy charcoal and cereals.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and cereals

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 6 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be a business-oriented man. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes, shoes, belts, etc. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a very busy area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of stock to resell. 

He will use the 60,000 Kes (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy clothes, belts and shoes. His business goal is to run a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his retail shop business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes, shoes and belts.

loans.name: Mwethya

texts.en:
Mwethya is 73 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She has been operating a grocery store for five years. She also does farming to earn extra income. Being a new member of Faulu Kenya, she appreciates the financial training conducted by Faulu Kenya. This has helped her to grow her savings.

Mwethya hopes to grow her business into a wholesale one in the future. She will use the loan to buy tomatoes and kale.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and kale.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline's Group is comprised of two hard-working women. Jackline is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasese, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children; one of them is currently in school. For the past four years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells herbal liquid soap. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chemicals that will be used for making the liquid soap for sale, which will help Jackline to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to build a permanant house for herself. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more chemicals that will be used for making liquid soap for sale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 21 years old and single. He used his previous loan to buy a motorbike. His business grew, because he was able to run his business more efficiently. He has requested another loan of 100,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings), to buy another motorbike.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Widad

texts.en:
Widad is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Madi, appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured next to the family's new house.

Widad is a 41-year-old woman. She is a mother to three sons and one daughter. She is a housewife, and her husband and her elder son are workers with low salaries.

Widad wants to share responsibility with her husband to completely finish their house, so she is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of installing tiles, windows and doors to the house. Taking this loan will create for Widad and her family suitable home conditions, so they can enjoy living in their new house.

loans.use: To finish the house.

loans.name: Tacuaree Poty Group

texts.es:
El comite Takuaree Poty son todas de la zona de San Lorenzo, son 23 integrantes  muy responsables que a pesar de ser un numeroso grupo se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder procurar una mejor vida para sus familias.
Zulma es la presidenta del grupo, ella es una persona con grandes sueños y anhelos, nos cuenta que está saliendo adelante y que siempre se inspira en su familia cuando trabaja, ya que quiere darles lo mejor. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles, y solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
All 23 members of the “Takuaree Poty” committee are from the District of San Lorenzo. They are very responsible members. Despite being a large group, the members are able to help one another so that they can secure a better life for their families.

Zulma is the group president. She is a person with great dreams and wishes. Zulma says that she presses forward and is always inspired by her family whenever she works so that she can give them the best. She sells food and is requesting a loan to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies so that she can continue preparing meals to sell. Zulma is grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 30 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has six children between the ages of 2 and 15 years old. Three of her children are in school and all live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling rice, pepper, vita, etc. in the local market. She enjoys the way her customers respond to her business and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, etc for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sewei

texts.en: Sewei lives with her friend and two children at Congo Town. She is 33 and stopped her education in the tenth grade. Her children are between the ages of 1 and 13; only one of them is in school. For the past four years, she has been selling lapa (a traditional cloth) in the market. She started first as a teacher at one of the schools in the  community before getting into business. She is proud of this business because she makes a profit when she sells, and she uses the profit to buy more goods and to contribute toward the expenditures of the family. Sewei is requesting this loan to purchase more lapa for the business. Her dream is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more lapa (traditional cloth) to sell

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a married woman. She describes herself as a humble woman. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals such as maize, black beans and other beans, etc. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are local people. She describes her biggest challenge to be a shortage of funds to improve her retail business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy cereals to sell. Her goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be a successful businesswoman. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie, 37, is married and lives in West Point. Mamie is a mother of three children who are between the ages of 12 and 17 years old and are attending school. She has been involved in this business for the past 15 years. She sells tomatoes, peppers, onions, salt, palm oil and vita in the community market. She makes a profit when she sells because her table is right in the front row of the market. With the profit, she buys more goods to improve the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, onions, salt, and palm oil for the business. Her plan is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, onions, salt and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children between the ages of 20 and 28 years old. All of them are in school and one lives at home. She stopped her education in the fourth grade. For the past 25 years, she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant). She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her oldest sister. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, onions, peppers, rice, charcoal, and salt for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to save. Her plans are to build her house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase oil, onions, peppers, rice, charcoal and salt to sell

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a young man, 26 years old. He is married and a father to one son. Haitham is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past two years, Haitham has had a store for selling men's clothes, which has been profitable and a second source of income for the family. Haitham has many loyal customers, because he offers high-quality clothes, and his store is well-located.

Haitham is requesting a USD loan from FATEN, to cover the cost of purchasing and bringing into the store, a new collection of men's clothes. This will increase sales and improve Haitham's income.  Haitham's photo was taken in his store.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of men's clothes to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol  y adicional a esto café y naranjo, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; Pedro es un hombre activo, entregado a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, piensa trabajar con esfuerzo y constancia para no rendirse en el camino; en las ultimas cosechas tuvo muchos problemas y perdidas y desea recuperarse, hará una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, café, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. Pedro tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 44, lives with his life partner and their children. He grows corn and beans, as well as coffee and oranges. Pedro has worked as a farmer for several years and has gained valuable experience that has allowed him to achieve better harvests. The land that he cultivates is located in an area that experiences high levels of agricultural activity and is located near his home. Pedro sells his crops in all of the areas surrounding his community. He has gained many customers who prefer to do business with him because everything he sells is of first-rate quality. In addition, he offers affordable prices and good service.

Pedro is an active man who is devoted to his work and eager to get ahead. He is always looking for opportunities that will help him become successful. Pedro believes that working hard and being persistent will keep him on track. During the most recent harvests, Pedro experienced many problems, resulting in losses that he hopes to recover. He wants to make a new investment that will increase production, so Pedro is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy corn, bean, and coffee seeds. He will also buy compost, insecticides, tools, and other supplies. Pedro has good credit references who vouch for his ability to repay this debt so that he can achieve financial security for his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds (corn, bean, and coffee), compost, insecticides, tools, and other supplies.

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn is 31 years old and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Marelyn has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Geralda

texts.en:
Geralda is 63 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has no children. 

Geralda has a general store. She has had this business for almost 12 years. She requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste and other dry goods products.

Geralda joined PMPC just this year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is married with four children. Celerina is 47 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Celerina sells pig lechon to earn a living and had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase pigz to cook as lechon to sell.  Celerina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Celerina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pigz to use in making lechon to sell

loans.name: Melaluna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Melaluna works hard to support her family.

She has a general store and sells feed in the Philippines. She earns additional income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane. Melaluna is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store business.

Melaluna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with two children.

Alicia sells special alamang (salted fish) and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more stocks of special alamang.

Alicia became a member of PMPC in 2012. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more salted fish

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is married with one child. Ronalyn is 35 years old and lives in Bobongan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Ronalyn owns a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 18 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and other dry goods.

Ronalyn is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Ronalyn hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more shampoo, toothpaste and other dry goods to sell

loans.name: Nympa

texts.en:
Nympa is 38 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

Nympa works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

Nympa has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Nympa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 56 years old and lives in Silucap, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 5 children.

Maura works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase boxes of fishes to sell on a retail basis.

Maura has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Maura hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 46 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 4 children.

Flora works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 23 years. She has requested loan to purchase boxes of fish to sell on a retail basis.

Flora has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Flora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 40 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children.
