Merlie has a general store . She has had this business for almost 2 years. She requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and other  consumable products.

Merlie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Merlie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and other  consumable products

loans.name: Germelina

texts.en:
Germelina is 58 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with 7 children. 

Germelina is engaged in farming activities, particularly in rice and coconut production and earns approximately PHP 2,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to be used to redeem mortgaged coconut land.
 
Germelina has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future Germelina hopes to engaged in other type of business.

loans.use: To redeem mortgaged coconut land

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for 12 years. Analyn earns additional income from raising pigs.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jeje May

texts.en:
Jeje May is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jeje May is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jeje May has a buying and selling of fish business in the Philippines. Jeje May requested a 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Jeje May has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Jeje May would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en:
Ursulina is 64 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children.
 
Ursulina is engaged in a dressmaking and repair activity and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional cloth and accessories for her dressmaking and repair activity.

Ursulina has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Ursulina hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional cloth and accessories.

loans.name: Ensherah

texts.en:
Ensherah, who appears in the photo, is a Palestinian woman. She is married and a mother to one son, who is ten years old. Ensherah is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all her needs.

Ensherah is requesting a USD loan from FATEN, to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Ensherah to do her homework and reports for work, and help her son in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Ensherah and improve the family's living conditions. 

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop

loans.name: Alfreda's Group

texts.en:
Alfreda is 58 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with one child.
 
Alfreda is engaged in a dried fish vending business and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional dried fish to sell. 

Alfreda has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Alfreda hopes to expand her business. Alfreda is the leader of a three-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 30 years old and has three children. Mary Ann is married and has two children who are in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a 12,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and pigs for her business.

Mary Ann has been pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and pigs for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Solidarias es de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas son 14 mujeres que dan todo lo mejor de sí para poder ayudar a sus familias y poder darles todo lo que necesitan.
Una mujer muy trabajadora es Clara, quien por medio de la costura esta saliendo adelante, cuenta que tiene una buena clientela, y que es gracias a su esfuerzo que está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de telas, para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres Solidarias” (Supportive Women) is from the city of Caacupé. These 14 women give their best effort so that they can help their families and provide everything they need.

One of these hardworking women is Clara. She is able to get ahead by working as a seamstress. Clara has a good clientele. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to move forward. Clara is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics so that she can complete the orders from her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and has six children. She is 64 years old and lives in San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Erlinda buys and sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

location.town: Liloy-San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fishing equipment for her fishing/fish vending business.

Nonita has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Nonita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Lowell

texts.en:
Lowell is 30 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban,  Misamis Occidental. He is married with no children. 

Lowell is engaged in the copra (dried coconut meat) trading business and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts and copra for his copra trading business. 

Lowell has been a member of PMPC since just this year. In the future, Lowell hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts and copra (dried coconut meat).

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy more stock of balut (fertilized duck egg) and crackers. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 45,000 PHP loan to purchase more stock of balut and crackers. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Zenaida dreams of growing her business and being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for stock of balut (fertilized duck egg) and crackers needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children.
 
Rosita has a store, which sells a variety of products -- soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP (Philippine Pesos), to purchase more stock for her general store.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for six years. Rosita hopes to own a house and lot, some day.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as cooking oil, bread and biscuits, for her general store

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su familia. Él se dedica   a la agricultura, comercio de cerdos. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y reconocimiento en la zona. Él y su esposa son muy conocidos en la zona por ser muy honestos y trabajadores. Tiene clientes fijos los cuales cada día lo prefieren más ya que siempre encuentran lo que buscan a los mejores precios. Como todo hombre emprendedor y visionario ha decidido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de más cerdos así podrá solventar la situación económica de su hogar y lograr así un incremento en sus ingresos. Espera lograr su sueño de  mejorar las oportunidades de vida de él y de su familia. Tiene plena confianza que de esta forma logrará su objetivo.
texts.en: Miguel lives in a house of his own together with his family. He works in agriculture and sells pigs. He has been in this business for many years and is thus very experienced and well-known in his area. He and his wife are considered very reputable people by the neighbours, who all agree that they are honest and hard-working. Miguel has recurring customers, who come to him because he has what they want at the best price. As any intelligent entrepreneur would do, he decided to ask field partner INTEGRAL for a loan in order to plan for the future by buying more pigs. Thus, he will be able to improve his family's financial situation and have a better income. He hopes to make his dream of improving his family's lot in life come true. He is very confident that this will be made possible thanks to this loan.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 52 years old and lives in Clarin Settlement, Oroquieta City. She is single. 

To earn a living, Wilma has engaged in a snack vending business. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Wilma has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients for puto (a kind of rice cake) and ice candy (a frozen treat).

Wilma has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and own a mini snack inn someday.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more firewood to resell.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
This is Trinidad. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Trinidad dreams of growing her business and hopes to give her family a good future by God's grace. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Composed of 15 to 30 community partners, the fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is an active member of PMPC.  She is 37 years of age and married with two school-age children.  She lives in Poblacion, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She engages in selling processed foods and earns a monthly average of PHP 2,000.  

She took another loan from PMPC in the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase more processed products for sale.  Hilda plans to use the profit to support family needs and the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more processed food products for sale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 35 years old, married, and has one child, who is in school.  

Wilma is in the business of raising pigs, in the Philippines. Wilma requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to purchase additional feed for her pigs. Wilma has been raising pigs for five years, and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past, to sustain her business.

Wilma would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a 38-year-old married woman from Corella, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest child is 17 while the youngest is 8. She has been in the food vending business for 10 years. She sells homemade spaghetti, fried chicken and pinakbet (mixed vegetables and pork stew cooked with bagoong, which are anchovies), as well as fruit flavored juice like pineapple, mango and orange. 

She earns 4,500 pesos a month by doing the food vending business. She requested a loan of 17,000 pesos to buy more merchandise like fruit juices, spaghetti, chicken, tomato sauce, vegetables like squash, ampalaya (bitter gourd), pork and cooking oil. 

In the future, Janette would like to invest in other ventures to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy items like fruit flavored juice, chicken, vegetables and spaghetti.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Emelina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling kitchen wares.  Emelina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Emelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a fifty-one-year-old married woman, and the mother of two young children in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines.

Crisanta has run a sari-sari, or convenience store business, for several years. She sells various goods to the people in their community.

Crisanta is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, snack food, soap, soda, dry goods and others. Through this loan, Crisanta will finally be able to add to her stocks in her store.

In the future, Crisanta dreams of making her business a success, and saving money for the schooling of her chidlren.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, snack food, soap, soda, dry goods and others

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 66 years old, and a widowed mother with seven children. One of her children is in school.

Lydia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lydia has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Lydia has been farming rice for ten years, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is 75 years old; she is a widow with 8 children. Salud works very hard to provide for them.

Salud runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Salud has been in this business for 14 years, and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, bread, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Salud would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bangus pry (milk fish) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional bangus pry to sell for her bangus pry business.

Josephine has been in this business for 15 years. Josephine earns more income from raising chickens and motorcycle transport.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bangus pry (milk fish) to sell.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
Darlyn is a 24 year old married woman and a mother of four young children. She is from Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. She is in the fishing business, together with her husband, and has been for more than three years now. This is the source of their income.

Darlyn needs a loan to buy fishing nets and hooks, lead weights, bucket and other items.

In the future, Darlyn wants to improve their way of living and support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and hooks, lead weights, bucket and other items.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Esmeralda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing and fish selling businesses in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Esmeralda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Esmeralda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
This is Adora, 61, resident of GMA, Philippines. She is married to Glicerio, and a mother to her children. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Adora believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Adora operates an internet café business. There is more need now, than before, for services like these as customers’ demands increase. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for their school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or any office documentation; as well as people who would just love to surf the net and any social network.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Adora dreams to have a good future and hopes to expand her business all by the grace of God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 51-year-old widow with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Daisy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Michinnie

texts.en: Michinnie is a micro-finance member of PMPC.  She is a 31-year-old single mom with 2 school-age children.  She has engaged in selling gasoline for 5 years with average monthly earnings of PHP 2,500.  She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional gasoline for resale.  Michinnie plans to use the profit to provide quality education of her children, hoping to improve their quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional gasoline for sale

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a 54-year-old married woman from Sikatuna, Bohol. She is a tailor (a person whose occupation is making or altering outer garments). She has been in the tailoring business for 26 years.Her tailoring business is located in her home. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional cloth, a new sewing machine, and sewing materials like thread, zippers, sewing needles and scissors. Epifania would like to expand her business to be successful so at the same time she can invest in other ventures for a better livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and a sewing machine

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en: Praxedes is 64 years old. She is widowed with 2 adult-age children. She has engaged in selling rice cakes for 8 years, earning a monthly average of PHP 2,000.  She's been a member of PMPC since 2010. She has requested another loan from PMPC in the amount of PHP 4,000 to purchase raw ingredients to make rice cakes.  She plans to use the profit to support her family's needs and to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make rice cakes

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin is a 32-year-old married man who runs a convenience store in Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in this business for more than ten years now. His wife supports him in running their business.

Darwin needs more capital. He is requesting a loan to buy additional items to sell such as dry goods, snack food, shampoo, soap, etc.

Darwin hopes to make his business productive and sustainable. Furthermore, he wants to save money for the schooling of his four young children.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as dry goods, snack food, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 72 years old and married.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (variety store) in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emma has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for twenty years and also earns an income from retailing gasoline.

Emma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 50, a resident of GMA, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her child. She, together with her child, manages their household as they operate the business. At this time, she is working hard to support their everyday needs.

Teresita operates an internet café business. There is more need, now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume and/or office documentation; as well as people who would just love to surf the net and participate in social networks. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Teresita dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her child a good future by the help of God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Bujlham

texts.en:
Mrs. Bujlham is 39 years old, lives with her husband and son in her recently built house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has worked as a bookkeeper in a private kindergarten since 2011. Her husband has worked as a driver for a building company for 5 years. During the last 7 years, they have saved every penny of their money to build a house. However, her house is located in a boundary area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Her family is living a life full of happiness now that they have their own private house. Before building the house they lived in a rented house. 

Bujlham and her husband have been running a taxi business in their spare time to increase the family income. Before the winter, her family has built their house hurry-scurry and interior finishings like walls, roof insulation, and installation of a heating system, are still to be completed. Mrs.Bujlham is requesting 5,000,000 MNT loan. The loan she is taking will be used to complete the interior of her house by using energy-saving materials and to install a low-pressure furnace which generates less harmful chemicals in order to save the environment.

loans.use: To complete her house interior construction by using energy-saving materials and to install low-pressure furnace which generates less harmful chemicals in order to save the environment

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en: A beautiful woman by name Khursheda lives in a house which is in bad condition. She is widow and has a clever daughter who is 17 years old.  Khursheda and her daughter want to live in a house which is in good condition, but her income from sewing and selling national women’s clothes is not enough. She must to repair the roof of her house first and then she must repair rooms. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as wood, cement, paint, and wallpaper to repair her house. In this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy. Please, help her if it possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood, cement, paint, and wallpaper for repairing her house

loans.name: Jade

texts.en: Jade is an active microfinance member of PMPC. He is 24 years old and married with two school-age children. His primary source of income for his livelihood is cell phone repair. He has been in the business for a period of two years with a monthly average income of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). He took another loan from PMPC in the amount of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional tools and phone accessories. He plans to use the profit to provide for the daily needs of his family and the education expenses of the children.  He hopes that the living conditions of the family will improve someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and phone accessories

loans.name: Gladwell

texts.en: Gladwell is a 43 year old mixed crop farmer. She is married to Peter, a businessman, and is blessed with three children.  She has been in the farming business for the past fifteen years, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully, and will use the money to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business Gladwell will buy a dairy cow and start a pig project, which will increase her monthly income. Her hopes and dreams are to lease more land and get into the business of horticultural farming.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertlizer.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 39 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in business for 22 years, and earns additional income from raising pigs. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is a 63 year old widow with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a food production business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her operation. Lourdes has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik is a 32-year-old married father with two children. He owns his grocery store and sells various foodstuffs. He established his business in this field four years ago. Malik is very hardworking and has a good reputation in his local community. He borrowed 900 AZN from Agroinvest Credit Union to import products for his store. Malik wants to grow his business and increase benefits while providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to import products for his store

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice lives in Kisauni, Mombasa. She is single, hard working and devoted to what she is currently doing. Eunice is an enthusiastic person who puts all her effort into helping herself get ahead. She runs a small food stall business where she sells a variety of dishes for breakfast, lunch and dinner. She has been in this business for a long time and it is her only source of income. Eunice has requested a loan in order to buy ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, etc. In the future, she plans to grow and expand her business and to improve her standard of living. She appreciates the support from Yehu and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is a married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She has two children. She provides services like manicures and pedicures. Gemma has been in the cosmetics and beauty business for ten years. She requested a loan of 12,000 to buy materials for manicures and pedicures like nail polish, nipper (any of various devices such as pincers) for gripping, breaking, or cutting (nails or cuticle), and brushes. In the future, Gemma would like to invest in other ventures  in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for manicures and pedicures such as nail polish, pincers and brushes

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a widow and has 4 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Mitazan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
Nelia is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of Php 14,000 to purchase more coconuts to sell. 
Nelia has been a member of PMPC for 8  years. In the future, Nelia hopes to see all her children successful someday.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa has been an active micro-finance member of PMPC since 2010. She is 32 years old, and married with 3 school-aged children. She has been engaged in raising pigs for almost 2 years, with an average monthly income of Php 1,000. She is taking another loan from PMPC to purchase feed and piglets to raise. She plans to use the profit to support the educational needs of her children. She hopes to improve the living condition of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat is 26 years old and a married man. For 3 years Nemat has been breeding cattle. Although he is young, he is a good businessman, because he works hard with great pleasure. His monthly net profit is 250 AZN. This is the second time Nemat has requested a loan for Agroinvest CU. His main purpose is to increase his number of animals and of course to get profit.
He hopes that borrowing 800 AZN from Agroinvest CU will help and ensure his local business development.

loans.use: to increase his number of animals

loans.name: Anemia

texts.en:
Anemia is married with 7 children. Anemia is 57 years old and lives in Manguehan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.
Anemia is engaged in a vegetable-vending business to earn a living, and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more vegetables & to purchase seedlings to be planted also.
Anemia has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Anemia hopes to expand her business someday.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables & to purchase seedlings

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which lies in the northern part of the Rift Valley. She has 7 children.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Feeding cows and sheep and doing general farm work!' Her biggest challenge is 'Diseases'. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Chemwai and Kiyo'. She will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Susan has been doing this work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, transportation services.

Susan was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because i have seen Juhudi Kilimo improving the lives of people in my village by financing farmers'. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'I learnt about the kind of projects financed by micro-finance institutions'.

Her highest monthly expenses are farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Susan replied, 'I will sell milk and get money to feed my family and also educate my children'.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Susan owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and farming rice. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 24500 through NWTF to purchase additional firewood to sell for her buy and sell firewood business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Rithilia

texts.en:
Rithilia is 40 years old, married, and has five children. They live in a neighborhood in the town of Kisauni, Kenya.
Rithilia has a store where she sells food products (rice, beans, lard, flour, cornmeal, sugar, soft drinks, and bread), as well as other home products. She started this business with her own money and later used the profits to increase her inventory. Rithilia currently has an established customer base, which allows her to increase her sales and experience more demand for the products she offers.
At the moment, Rithilia is requesting her first loan so that she can invest in the purchase of food products, medicines, and grocery products. Her dream is to increase her sales and her earnings so that she can grow financially, support her children’s education, and achieve a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase food products, medicines, and grocery products.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito is 62 years old and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child. 
Benito has a store that sells a variety of products such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many more. He has had this business for four years. Benito requested a loan of 14000 Pesos to purchase more stock for his general store, such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies etc.
Benito has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Benito hopes to own a house & lot someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is married with six children. She is 53 years old and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City.
Sabina is engaged in a charcoal business to earn a living, and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase wood & coconut shells (to make charcoal).
 
Sabina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Sabina hope to have more income & savings in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wood & coconut shells (used in making charcoal)

loans.name: Kulbarchin

texts.ru: Кульбарчын состоит в группе "Жакшылык". Кульбарчын 57 лет,проживает с мужем, на пенсии.По характеру Кульбарчын очень жизнерадостная, добрая, честная и оптимистичная женщина.Кульбарчын является Матерью-героиней(для информации - в Советском Союзе такое звание присваивалось матерям больших семей) -она с мужем воспитала 8  детей, большая часть из которых сегодня проживает в столице Бишкек.После распада СССР, Кульбарчын начала заниматься сельским хозяйством - животноводством и продажей молока. Муж Кульбарчын помогает ей по хозяйству. Благодаря их трудолюбию и целеустремленности на сегодняшний день у них очень развитое и ухоженное хозяйство, ежемесячный доход семьи составляет около 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Кульбарчын обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)на покупку 12 голов овец и 1 коровы, так как сейчас это выгодная покупка в связи с низкими ценами на скот. За счет доходов от полученного кредита планируют увеличить поголовье скота и соответственно улучшить условия жизни.В будущем Кульбарчын собирается также увеличивать поголовье скота, что поможет ей осуществит давнюю мечту - построить дом.
texts.en: Kulbarchin is a member of the "Zhakshylyk" group. She is 57 years old and lives with her husband. Kulbarchin is a cheerful, kind and honest woman. Kulbarchin is a Mother Heroine [note: this is a title from Soviet times, given to mothers of large families], as she and her husband raised 8 children, most of whom now live in Bishkek. After the fall of the USSR, Kulbarchin began working in agriculture - animal husbandry and milk sales. Her husband helps her with the farming. Thanks to her hard work and determination, today their farm is very developed and well-maintained. The monthly income of their family is approximately 3,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS). Because livestock prices are currently low, Kulbarchin wants to increase the number of livestock she has, and has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy 12 sheep and 1 cow. She plans to use the income that will be generated by this purchase to increase her herd and thus improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to further increase her herd, which will help to realize her long-held dream of building a house.

loans.use: To buy 12 sheep and 1 cow

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 35 years old, married and supports a family of five people. He has been a maize farmer for the last three years, earning a monthly income of 9,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

Patrick is servicing a fifth loan of 75,000 KES from KADET Ltd which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. Patrick has a very good credit history with KADET. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into keeping sheep. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 41-year-old  businessman. He is married to Florence and they are blessed with three children. Joseph operates a butchery as his primary business and a hotel [restaurant] with the support of his wife as his secondary business. He has had this business for the past ten years with a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) which he uses to support his family.

Joseph is applying for his first loan term with KADET Ltd after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joseph will use this loan to buy goats and bulls for slaughter. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a modern butchery.

loans.use: to buy goats and bulls for slaughter

loans.name: Arzuman

texts.en: Arzuman is a 57 year old man living in the town of Agsu, Azerbaijan. He earns about $200 per month selling the milk produced by his cows. He has requested a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase two dairy cows and expand his business. This will be his first loan with Aqroinvest. Arzuman's plan is to use any remaining funds from the loan to purchase food for his chickens and cows.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 38 years old, married, and has one child who currently attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a business in the Philippines where she buys and sells dried fish. Teresita has requested a loan of 30000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Teresita has been in this business for 16 years and in the future, she would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze lives in the community of Mwambalazi. She is married and has six children between the ages of 20 and 2 years. Mbodze has operated a food stall business for two years in her community. She started selling street food and she has now managed to expand it. In addition to this business, Mbodze does farming. She works on her farm in the morning hours and during the weekends, when her children are at home to assist her selling in the food stall.

Mbodze is requesting this loan in order to buy foodstuffs to prepare some dishes in order to better meet the needs of her customers from all the communities in her village. She hopes that the loan will help her increase the size of her stall and improve her living conditions. She is very happy for the financial support that Kiva lenders give her, because this way she is certain of making progress in her work.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to prepare some dishes

loans.name: Roselwe

texts.en:
Roselwe lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which lies in the northern part of the Rift Valley. She has seven children and has been doing her work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, transportation services, and a personal business.

Roselwe stated what is most enjoyable about farming is, "Keeping dairy cows and horticulture!" Her biggest challenge is animal feeds during dry season and diseases. The animals on her farm have been given the names of Korai, Cheboron and Lab. She will use this loan to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Roselwe was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Because it finances small holder farmers in their activities." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. She says, "It is short term loans for farmers."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?", Roselwe replied, "Money from the sale of milk will help in paying the school fees for my children and [provide] milk for drinking."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Roselwe owns the following: cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

======================================

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock, including canned goods, snacks and beverages, for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock, including canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tanzila

texts.en:
Tanzila is a 40-year-old, hard-working woman. She is married, the mother of two children and the owner of a general store. Tanzila started her business 12 years ago with a little capital that her husband gave her. She sells general items. Her son helps out with the business. Both Tanzila and her husband work hard to ensure the success of the store.

Tanzila has used the help that she has received from the AqroInvest CU to purchase merchandise, especially cleaning products, which are unavailable in other establishments in this part of the city. Having added more stock, she will be able to attract more customers and increase business. With her earnings, Tanzila plans to carry out home improvements, little by little.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, including cleaning products.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a single businessman who owns a retail shop, a business which he has been operating for one year. In this shop, Johnson sells sugar, flour, soap, salt, etc.

Johnson learned about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is bad debts.

Johnson is applying for a loan of 36,650 Kenya shillings to increase the stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He has set his ambition to owning a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To increase the stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Bonitas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama  “Mujeres Bonitas", está en su tercer ciclo y tiene 11 integrantes, donde todas se ayudan para trabajar y por medio de ese trabajo ir creciendo en el trabajo de cada una de ellas.
La Directora es la  Mariana, quien vende plantas. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona con muchas metas y objetivos por los cuales lucha.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de plantas de todo tipo y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: “Mujeres Bonitas" Communal Bank is in its third loan cycle and has eleven members.  They all help each other to work and through this work, each member’s business is increasing.  Mariana, the director, sells plants.  She describes herself as a person that strives to meet her many goals and objectives.  She is requesting the loan to purchase various types of plants and in this way, she will be able to continue working and supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase plants for sale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She previously received a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase grocery items needed for her business. Her earnings have helped with her children's education, personal household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 50,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She believes that having more items displayed for sale at the store will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will help support her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this increase in profit with happiness and is thankful in her heart.

Alma hopes that her business will turn into a grocery someday. She wants to become a successful business woman and hopes that her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good life once they settle down. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* because she finds that the sharing inspires her to be optimistic in her life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items needed for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for his grocery store.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 52 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gregoria is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Gregoria has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs, in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs. Jocelyn has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is from Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. 

Lita owns and operates an agricultural business of planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Lita has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns PHP8,000 a month. 

In 2007, Lita joined GDMPC. Lita is requesting a loan of PHP20,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase some clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ma. Flora

texts.en: Ma. Flora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Flora has requested a loan of 10000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business. Ma. Flora has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, she would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Fema

texts.en:
Fema is from Basirang, Tudela. She is 51 years old. Fema is married and has four children. To make a living, she manage a fishpond where she raises fish, crabs and shrimp for sale. She's been engaged in her business for three years and earns 5,000 Philippines pesos a month for these activities. 

Recently, Fema joined GDMPC. Fema is requesting a loan of 15,000 pesos, which will be used to buy young fish to raise and twine to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy young fish to raise and twine to expand the business

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se encuentra en su ciclo numero 16, las miembros son mujeres jefas de familia, que se unieron y quieren salir adelante trabajando juntas. Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Angelina, ella tiene 1 hijo  está casada  con el Sr. Oscar y ella tiene una Despensa. Gracias a este negocio puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa, y de esa forma dar a su hijo todo lo que necesita para poder tener un estilo de vida digna y sin privaciones.
Solicita este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, lácteos, carnes, y demás insumos para su negocio. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben, pues les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is in their 16th loan cycle.  The members are women who are heads of household.  They are united and working together to get ahead.  Angelina, one of the members of the group, has one son and is married to Oscar.   She has a pantry and thanks to this business, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses and provide her son with what he needs to have a decent lifestyle without hardships.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase beverages, dairy products, meat, and other supplies for her business.  They are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving as it will be a great help to them.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, dairy products, meat, and other supplies.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. She has five children and has been farming for five years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Profits from milk selling!" Her biggest challenge, she says, is maintenance and cleaning of her zero grazing unit. Animals on the farm have been given names like Mary.

Pamela was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Because of dairy cattle insurance." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. She responded, "It's very important to save because it will help you in future."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?," Pamela replied "By getting more milk to sell and improve the family income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, like each borrower her assets are evaluated. Pamela owns the following: cow, poultry, and bicycle; but does not own: pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito netting, running water, and a TV but does not have electricity, solar power, sewing machine, or DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité Renacer nace gracias la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en ese lugar.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Ramona es parte de este trabajador grupo, ella demuestra muchas ganas de salir adelante y de seguir trabajando, cuenta que se dedica a la costura y que ya tiene muy buena clientela y también muchos pedidos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos para poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes, y también seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Renacer” (Rebirth) is born thanks to the management and the support of a group of women who were working in the city of San Lorenzo.  The members of the communal bank established as their main objective the growth of each one of them personally and in terms of their work.

Ramona is part of this hardworking group.  She demonstrates a great desire to get ahead and to continue working.  She says that she makes a living sewing and that she already has a good clientele and also many orders.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies in order to be able to continue serving her customers and also to continue growing as a small-businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Victoriosas nace con 14 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, donde todas ellas deciden ayudarse para poder salir adelante en los sueños de cada una. La Sra. Ada es parte de este grupo, y cuenta que está saliendo adelante en su pequeño microemprendimiento, el cual es la venta de ropas y de lencería.
Ada, solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de verano y también de lencería, ya que desea comprar más variedad, para que de esa forma siempre tenga buena variedad de productos.
texts.en: The “Mujeres Victoriosas” Communal Bank was formed by 14 women from the city of San Lorenzo, where they all decided to help each other so that each one of them could get ahead and be able to fulfill their dreams.  Ada is part of this group and states that she is getting ahead in her small enterprise, selling clothing and lingerie.  Ada is requesting this loan to purchase men’s clothing and also lingerie because she wishes to purchase more variety so that she will always have a good selection of products.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and also lingerie for sale.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 49-year-old businessman. He is married to Lucy, who is a farmer. They are blessed with four children. He has been buying and selling fresh milk as his primary business. He also has sold new shoes as his secondary business for the past two years with the monthly income of 4,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Samson will use the loan to buy fresh milk from farmers for sale. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his two businesses, i.e. buy fresh milk in bulk for sale and increase stock of new shoes, to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fresh milk from farmers for sale.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a 32-year-old married woman from Albur, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is eight while the youngest is three. Jasmin is a kalamay vendor. She sells kalamay, which is a sticky sweet snack/dessert delicacy popular in the Philippines. It is made out of glutinous rice flour, coconut milk and sugar usually palm or brown sugar. 

Jasmin has been in the food vending business for thirty years (this business being inherited from her parents when she was two years old). She plans to use the loan to buy more kalamay ingredients like pilit (glutinous rice), brown sugar, plastic canisters and peanuts. In the future, Jasmin would like to expand her business to invest other ventures in order to earn a living while at the same sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy pilit (glutinous rice), brown sugar, plastic canisters, and peanuts

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité es un grupo muy activo,  siempre saben salir adelante, se encuentra en el ciclo 16º , tienen ahorros y siempre trabajan juntas para ayudarse.
La Sra. Olga es la presidenta, y cuenta que siempre trata de motivar a sus amigas del grupo y que no se desanimen, son varios los ciclos que están juntas y están saliendo adelante. Ella es modista y solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, e hilos, con lo cual hará todos los pedidos que tiene. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe, pues es muy importante.
texts.en: This is a very active group that always knows how to get ahead.  They are in their 16th cycle, have savings, and are always working together to help each other.  Olga is the president and says that she always tries to motive her friends in the group, telling them not to get discouraged.  They have gone through several loan cycles together and they are getting ahead.  She is a dressmaker and is requesting the loan to purchase fabric and thread, which she will use to fill all the orders she has.  She is grateful for the help that she is receiving because it is very important.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 34 years old and a carpenter. He is married to Patricia, a business lady. They are blessed with one child. He has been a carpenter for the past two years with the monthly income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Charles will use the loan to buy more timber for furniture making. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to have a well-equipped workshop.

loans.use: To buy timber for furniture making.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 27-year-old businessman. He is a single man but supports his parents. He has been running a retail shop as his primary business for the past three years with the monthly income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which he uses to cater for his basic needs. He also offers motorcycle repair services.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Daniel will use the loan to purchase more stock of sugar, rice and maize meal, etc. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his siblings. His hopes and dreams are to venture into mixed crop farming and be exporting his farm produce like French peas, French beans, etc.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of sugar, rice and maize meal.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has two children and has been doing dairy work for six years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Feeding my animals!" According to Esther, her biggest challenge is not having enough animal feed due to lack of enough capital. The animal pictured on the farm is named Lelgina.

Esther was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that she was informed by a client of Juhudi Kilimo of the low interest rate. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which she replied, "How make my own savings, credit management."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Esther replied, "More milk for sale hence more money for family upkeep." This loan will help her buy and insure a dairy cow.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Esther owns the following: cow, poultry, and bicycle; but does not own  a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito netting, electricity, solar power, TV, and DVD, but does not have running water or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
The desire to better herself is one of the most important dreams of this forty-year-old woman, who lives with her family. She owns a kiosk, where she sells basic necessities such as wheat and maize flours, sodas, and milk, among other things. She has a lot of experience in sales, and this helps her to obtain very good profits. She has built up a good customer base, because the people prefer her business for the quality of the products that she sells, as well as for the reasonable prices and the excellent service that is always at the customers' disposal. She is an enterprising woman, who is dedicated to her work.  She struggles every day to achieve a better future with new ideals, and not to be influenced by the social violence of her country. She is doing her utmost, as she is happy with her work and does not want to let her family down.

In recent months, demand has increased and she wants to take the opportunity to make a new investment. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Yehu that will allow her to buy flour, sugar, medicinal tablets, detergents, etc. to resell. She has good references to vouch for her payment history and is very responsible. She promises to pay off the debt and at the same time believes it can bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, medicinal tablets, detergents, etc., to resell at her kiosk.

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en:
Vugar is a 37 year old differently-abled single person who works with his father in a store. He manages a variety of products such as foodstuffs, plates, dishes, and so on. He lives and develops his career in Agsu district. Every day he sells products in his nearby market and monthly earns 100 AZN.

His aim is to increase own business, especially adding more household goods and and other products. He says that these activities will help him to increase monthly net profit.

Vugar has requested a loan amount of 1000 AZN for Agroinvest CU to purchase more stock of items in his store. He wants to increase level of sales and help his father.

loans.use: to purchase household goods and and other products.

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.en: Gunduz, 52, is married and has three sons. He has 5 years experience in business trading. He always tries to expand his field. Therefore Gunduz borrowed 1800 AZN from Agroinvest CU to buy new foodstuffs which is useful region customers. He manages his grocery store with courage. Gunduz earns about 150 AZN monthly net profits. This is his second loan. He appreciates the support and hopes that after repaying this loan and he will request another access.

loans.use: to buy new foodstuffs.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell for her general store business.

Raquel has been in this business for 10 years. Raquel earns more income from raising pigs.

Raquel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward lives in Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of four children. He owns a retail shop, which he has been operating for one year. In this shop, Edward sells items such as sugar, flour, soap, and salt.

Edward learned about Milango from a friend, and joined with an aim of accessing credit, to improve his business's operations. The business challenge he is facing is bad debts.

Edward is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings, to increase his stock of items such as sugar, flour, and cooking fat. The extra income from using the loan to increase his inventory, will be added to his savings.  Edward's ambitions are to improve the living standard of his family and to own another retail shop.

loans.use: To increase his stock of items such as sugar, flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a 48-year-old resident of Poblacion, Pana-on. She provides for the needs of her 5 children from the little amount of 4,000 she gains monthly from her own piggery business. For 5 years this has been an aid to the income gained from her husband. However in 2010 she became a member of GDMPC and she now applies for a micro-finance loan at GDMPC for 7,000 to buy feeding supplies. Rosalinda also wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres de Valor es un grupo muy activo, se encuentra en el ciclo numero 14, y cuentan que están contentas de estar en el grupo, ya que no solo las ayuda a ellas sino también a sus familias. La Sra. Nancy, es la tesorera del grupo , y siempre sabe  llevar bien adelante su puesto ya que es muy estricta, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todas clases y también realiza manicura y pedicuro y cuenta que desea seguir creciendo y ser el día de mañana una gran microempresaria.
Solicita del crédito para la compra de prendas y así seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: The “Mujeres de Valor” group is very active.  They are in their 14th loan cycle and they say that they are very happy to be in this group because it not only helps them, but helps their families.  Nancy, the group’s treasurer, knows how to get ahead because she is very strict. She sells all types of clothing and also does manicures and pedicures.  She says that she wishes to continue growing her business and be a great small business woman in the future.  She is requesting the loan to purchase clothing and in this way, continue working and supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en: Tigran is from Yerevan. He lives with his wife, Hasmik, and daughter, Lusine. Tigran works as an accountant and his wife is a seller. Tigran's daughter studies at the European Educational Regional Academy. She is in the 3rd course in the Faculty of Linguistics. Unfortunately, current income Tigran earns is barely enough to cover the household costs and does not allow him to save for Lusine's education. So Tigran has applied for this loan to get necessary funds to pay his daughter's tuition fee for the 1st semester. Lusine dreams of becoming a translator after graduation and having a job with enough salary to be financially independent. This loan is important for her to continue education and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition fee for the 1st semester.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi works selling fish in a store, selling to the neighborhood. She's a very hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead and have a better life. She'll be able to achieve this only through her effort because she has no financial support from anybody. Her business is located in the central market of the town where she lives. It's very well known because her merchandise is of very good quality and she sells it at prices people can afford. She also sells dumplings and fried potatoes at one of the primary schools. This is also a place where they meet for their group center meetings.

Mwanamkasi is requesting a loan from Yehu to invest in buying more fish, wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil. This way she hopes to be the first option for the people who need such goodies.

loans.use: to buy more fish, wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a resident of Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a charcoal business, which has been in operation for the last four years.

Chizi learned about Milango from a friend, and joined the organization with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main business challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Chizi is applying for a loan of 36,650 Kenyan shillings, to purchase additional stock of charcoal. The extra income from using the loan will be added to her savings, to improve the living standard of her family and pay for her children’s school fees. She aspires to be a wholesaler of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 45 years old and lives in Tipan, Oroquieta , Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children.

Concepcion has a business making and selling sun shades, and she earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP, to pay for labor and purchase bamboo wood.
 
Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. Concepcion hopes to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for labor and purchase bamboo wood

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is still repaying his Kiva loan that he received to pay for his daughter’s and his son’s education in a previous semester. Armen’s daughter has already completed studies at the Armenian “Haybusak” University. 

Now Armen is seeking a concurrent loan of 165,000 Armenian drams to pay his son’s tuition fee for the current semester.

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition fee for the current semester.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion, who is single, is 58 years old and resides at Tabuan, Tukuran. Concepcion owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 17 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to resell. Concepcion joined GDMPC in 2010. She wants to build a house in the future, and wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to resell

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en: Lilit lives in Yerevan with her parents. She studies in the European Regional Educational Academy in Yerevan. Lilit is in the fourth course in the Faculty of Economics. Lilit's mother works at a local firm, and her father is a builder. Lilit wants to find a job, too, and have her own income. Unfortunately, it's difficult for her to find an appropriate vacancy without experience. Her family's current income does not allow them to pay for Lilit's tuition. So Lilit has applied for this loan of 240,000 AMD, to pay for her education for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for her first semester tuition

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a grocery store, where she sells fruits and vegetables such as potatoes, mangoes, maize, onions, tomatoes, and cereals. She has been involved in this business for ten years. 

Julia's business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents and businesspeople. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for expanding her business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fruits and vegetables. 

Her business goal is to become a successful businesswoman within 5 years. She hopes to diversify her business activities into farming in the future, which would add another source of profit for meeting her family's financial needs. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to resell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma really enjoys her business of selling fish to people, and she has many plans for her business in the future. Since the last loan, she has been involved in food vending, selling foods that she prepared, from her home in the morning hours. From the money she earned with that business, she was able to save to start this current business of selling fish. 

At this time, Fatuma is seeking only to gather enough money to expand her business. She is requesting this loan in order to buy more stock of fish to resell. She hopes that the loan will help her increase the size of her market and the amount of products she can supply; thereby increasing her income and improving her living conditions.

Fatuma’s goals are to expand her business, and then expand her family. She is very happy to have the financial support from Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to resell.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva runs a sari-sari or convenience store business in Getafe, Bohol. She has been in this business for more than two years now. She sells various goods to the people in her locality.

Genoveva wants to take a loan to buy additional stock like noodles, snack food, biscuits, soda, rice and other inventory items.

In the future, Genoveva wants to make her business a success and to save money for the schooling of her children.
